title: E-Commerce Email Customer Success
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

We're seeking a Customer Support VA who operates as a gatekeeper for our Shopify supplement stores - not just someone who responds to tickets, but someone who actively protects revenue, maintains brand reputation, and keeps operations running smoothly.

You'll have clear SOPs and automation tools, but we need someone who uses judgment, spots patterns, and takes ownership. If you're the type who sees customer support as a revenue center (not a cost center), this role is for you.

What You'll Own:



Handle really high-volume tickets using our automated ticketing system (we do have automations in place, macros and other support tools for this)

Manage subscriptions strategically (retain when appropriate, cancel cleanly when needed)

Track orders through Shopify + 17Track and proactively solve delivery issues

Process refunds/cancellations per policy while protecting against abuse

Escalate chargebacks, legal threats, or policy violations with context

Maintain inbox to zero daily - nothing falls through the cracks

Flag operational issues (supplier delays, product complaints, system bugs)



You're the Right Fit If You:



Have proven Shopify + Richpanel (or Gorgias/Zendesk) experience

Write clearly in English and type fast

Can follow SOPs but know when to deviate with good reason

Read between the lines - you catch fraud, serial refunders, and escalation risks

Are obsessively detail-oriented

Want a long-term role where competence = responsibility + growth



Starting with a 2-week paid trial. After successful completion, this becomes a stable, long-term position.

title: Experienced Digital Marketing (AU hours) - Longterm
description:
TITLE:

Digital Marketing Coordinator (aka; Advertising, Media & Communications Manager)



BUSINESS:

Our business is a dream to work for…

• We provide content promotion and lead generation to global personalities and professionals.

• Our focus (and soon to be your focus) is to help global personalities and professionals succeed by driving attention to their most powerful educational content and drive leads to their business to increase their sales. To do this, we recruit the best video editors, graphic designers, content writers, paid ad media buyers and more.



ROLE:

This role is perfect for you, if…

• You are looking to work in a role of an experienced Digital Marketing Coordinator

• You want to work on multiple clients marketing campaigns, working with media buyers/graphic designers/video editors/content writers

• You have confidence and enjoy speaking professionally with clients (written and verbal)

• You want to work remotely, full time (40 hours) a week - Monday to Friday

• You’re interested in Day Shift hours, during Melbourne, Australia business hours

• You have a University Level Education

• And, you already have advanced skills in building (or running) paid digital advertising campaigns



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Your responsibilities will include…

• Build and execute comprehensive project plans for marketing campaigns

• Coordinate with internal and external delivery teams, including clients, graphic designers, content writers, video editors, content writers, media buyers and developers

• Enforce end-to-end message congruency from the ad creative, ad copy, landing page copy, resource, etc

• Define the #1 pain point being solved by the campaign and ensure it hits the desired target market

• Identify project issues, roadblocks or missing requirements quickly and resolve proactively

• If necessary, re-write and optimise content - such as; ad copy, funnel copy,
 copy, etc

• Ensure a campaign has the highest chance of success prior to going live

• Document and handover all campaign, funnel and ad resources to media buyer for them to manage post go-live

We will provide training on how to execute each item above, as long as you are the type of person who has the will to learn and master it.



REQUIREMENTS:

To be considered for this position, you are required to:

• You need to have a proven solid work experience as a digital marketing coordinator of at least 2+ years

• You need to have a Computer/Laptop with at least i5 processor and 8gb of RAM

• You need to have a 2nd computer screen in your home office

• You need to have a fast and reliable Internet connection, with access to a back-up

• You have leadership abilities, decision-making skills, and problem-solving capabilities.

• You have proven experience as a content writer in lead generation, or project manager in a lead generation, or operated in a digital marketing environment.

• You have a results-driven mindset with a commitment to achieving project objectives.

• You have a strong attention to detail and highly organised

• You have a friendly, upbeat and team focused attitude

• Most importantly, you desire to learn and obtain new responsibilities



SOFTWARE & TOOLS:

• Zoom - video meetings (internal team and client communication)

• Loom - screen recording software (internal team and client communication)

• Slack - internal communication tool

• ClickUp - task management software

• Google
 (gmail)

• Google Drive

• Google Sheets



How to Apply: Attached your CV link with your cover letter

title: Instagram Appointment Setter
description:
Join the Dream Team and Make a Difference



The Dream Team Academy is a leading online fitness coaching company with a global community of over 1.1 million followers. Our mission is to empower busy Filipino nurses to transform their lives, helping them lose weight, regain confidence, and build a healthier lifestyle without sacrificing the foods they love. We are looking for a highly motivated and emotionally intelligent Appointment Setter to join our remote team and play a key role in our growth.



Position: Appointment Setter

•Location: Remote (Philippines only)

•Schedule: Monday to Friday, 10:00 PM - 4:00 AM Manila Time



The Role

As an Appointment Setter, you will be the first point of contact for potential clients, engaging with them on social media to understand their goals and challenges. Your ability to build rapport and ask insightful questions will be crucial in identifying qualified leads and booking them for consultations with our coaching team. This is a vital role that directly contributes to our mission of changing lives.



Key Responsibilities

•Engage with prospective clients on Instagram and
 using our proven scripts and frameworks.

•Build trust and rapport through authentic, empathetic conversations.

•Ask strategic questions to qualify leads based on their goals, challenges, and readiness to commit.

title: Early intervention service coordinator
description:
Bright Future Kiddie Care – New York, NY

Full-Time / Part-Time



?



Job Overview



Bright Future Kiddie Care is seeking a dedicated Early Intervention Service Coordinator to support families with infants and toddlers (birth–3) who qualify for Early Intervention services in New York State. The Service Coordinator helps families navigate evaluations, IFSP meetings, service authorizations, provider communication, and ongoing progress monitoring.



This role is ideal for someone who is organized, compassionate, and enjoys working closely with families and interdisciplinary teams.



?



Key Responsibilities



Initial Service Coordination

 • Contact families referred to the Early Intervention Program

 • Explain the EI process, family rights, and service options

 • Assist families in scheduling evaluations

 • Gather medical, developmental, and social history



Ongoing Service Coordination

 • Participate in the development and review of the Individualized Family Service Plan (IFSP)

 • Ensure that all authorized EI services begin in a timely manner

 • Maintain ongoing communication with providers, evaluators, and families

 • Monitor service delivery and ensure services match the IFSP



Family Support

 • Help families access community resources (e.g., WIC, SNAP, housing supports, mental health services)

 • Provide guidance, emotional support, and advocacy

 • Ensure families understand their rights and procedural safeguards



Documentation & Compliance

 • Maintain accurate service notes and progress documentation

 • Submit all paperwork within required timelines

 • Utilize the NYS EI data system (e.g., NYEIS or EI-Hub)

 • Ensure compliance with NYSDOH Early Intervention regulations



Coordination of Meetings

 • Schedule and participate in IFSP meetings

 • Assist with annual and 6-month reviews

 • Help families transition from EI to CPSE (age 3)



?



Qualifications

 • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in:

 • Social Work

 • Psychology

 • Early Childhood Education

 • Human Services

 • Nursing

 • Public Health

 • Related fields

 • Experience working with families and young children (preferred)

 • Strong communication, organization, and time-management skills

 • Ability to work independently and manage multiple cases

 • Must pass background checks and complete NYSDOH-required trainings



?



Skills & Competencies

 • Compassionate and family-centered

 • Knowledge of early childhood development

 • Ability to multitask and manage deadlines

 • Strong writing and documentation skills

 • Comfortable conducting home visits and virtual meetings

 • Familiar with community resources



?



What We Offer

 • Competitive pay

 • Flexible schedule

 • Training and ongoing professional development

 • Supportive and collaborative team environment

 • Opportunity to grow within Bright Future Kiddie Care’s expanding agency

title: Operations & Inventory Manager – Piano Industry E-Commerce (Advanced Excel Required)
description:
JOB TITLE

Operations & Inventory Manager – Piano Industry E-Commerce (Full-Time Remote)



ABOUT US

We are a U.S.-based specialty supplier serving piano technicians, schools, and institutions nationwide. We sell technical tools, parts, and supplies through e-commerce platforms and direct distribution.



This is a systems-driven business. Precision, inventory control, and purchasing discipline matter.



We are hiring a high-level Operations & Inventory Manager to take ownership of purchasing decisions, inventory health, and operational performance.



This is a leadership role, not a task-based assistant role.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR



• You think in systems, not tasks

• You are comfortable making purchasing decisions

• You enjoy working with data and spreadsheets

• You have managed people before

• You are comfortable being accountable for numbers



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Inventory & Purchasing Ownership

• Monitor stock levels and reorder points

• Create and issue purchase orders

• Manage supplier communication

• Improve inventory turnover

• Reduce stockouts and overstock



Operational Oversight

• Coordinate with U.S. warehouse staff

• Track fulfillment accuracy and order speed

• Build and maintain SOPs

• Identify inefficiencies and fix them



Team Leadership

• Manage Filipino tea
mbers

• Set performance expectations

• Provide weekly KPI reporting



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



• 3+ years in operations, supply chain, or inventory management

• Advanced Excel / Google Sheets

• Experience creating dashboards or KPI reports

• Strong written and spoken English

• Experience making purchasing decisions



COMPENSATION



$12–$16 per hour depending on experience

Performance-based bonus available



APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS



IMPORTANT: In the first line of your application, write “Precision & Tempo”.



Include:



A 3–5 minute Loom video explaining a purchasing or inventory system you managed.



Your expected monthly salary in USD.



Answers to the questions below.



SCREENER QUESTIONS



How do you determine how much inventory to reorder?



What KPIs would you track in a warehouse operation?



Describe a time you reduced stockouts or excess inventory.



A supplier raises prices 12%. What steps do you take before issuing your next purchase order?



What Excel formulas do you use most frequently?

title: Accessibilty Specialist (Documents / PDFs)
description:
This role requires advanced accessibility expertise and attention to detail, rather than general graphic design capability

alone. The specialist supports the remediation and production of complex documentation to meet WCAG 2.2 AA and PDF accessibility standards, ensuring outputs are compliant, usable, and fit for purpose.



Key Responsibilities

• Produce high-end, accurate finished art across complex, long-form financial services documentation.

• Create accessible interactive form PDFs using Adobe InDesign and Acrobat.

• Remediate existing documents to meet WCAG 2.2 AA and PDF accessibility standards.

• Apply and validate correct tagging, reading order, alt text, structure, and logical document flow.

• Conduct screen reader testing and accessibility validation.

• Ensure all documents meet compliance requirements within regulated environments.

• Liaise with IVE stakeholders to clarify briefs and accessibility requirements.

• Maintain exceptional attention to detail and technical accuracy.



Essential Skills & Experience

• Experience working within corporate brand guidelines and compliance frameworks.

• Advanced Adobe InDesign skills — complex layouts, long-form documents, print and digital production.

• Proven experience creating accessible interactive PDFs in InDesign and Acrobat.

• Strong working knowledge of WCAG 2.2 AA and PDF accessibility standards.

• Demonstrated experience remediating documents for accessibility compliance.

• Confident conducting screen reader testing and validating tagging, reading order, alt text and document structure.

• Experience working with regulated or financial services documentation highly regarded.



Accreditations & Desirable Skills

• Accessibility accreditations or formal accessibility certifications.

• Familiarity with Common Look PDF or other remediation tools.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint for document formatting.



***Work from home ready

***Amenable to work around 6AM-3PM //7 AM-4PM MNL time

***Comfortable using time tracker (time doctor app)



Interested applicants may send their most updated CV and portfolio. Apply now!

title: Senior AML Consultant
description:
Senior AML Consultant (Remote, Philippines-based)



Benefits and Perks

• Join a fast-growing consultancy with clients across Australia, New Zealand, and the UK

• Fully remote role based in the Philippines

• Collaborative and supportive leadership team invested in your continued development

• Flexible working hours to support work-life balance

• Opportunities for professional growth and progression



About the Role

As a Senior AML Consultant, you will play a key role in delivering independent AML audits, advisory engagements, and compliance reviews for a diverse portfolio of clients. You will work closely with a wider team of consultants based across Australia and New Zealand and will take ownership of client deliverables with support from senior leadership where needed.



This is an exciting opportunity for someone with existing AML/CTF experience who is ready to step into a more senior, consultative role. You’ll be responsible for managing engagements end to end, contributing to internal improvement initiatives, and mentoring junior tea
mbers from time to time.



Strong English communication skills – both written and verbal – are essential, as you’ll be engaging directly with clients and preparing high-quality reports and advisory material.



Key Responsibilities

• Lead and support AML/CTF audits and reviews across a range of industries

• Prepare reports and deliver findings to clients in a clear, professional manner

• Provide practical advisory support tailored to client obligations and risk profiles

• Collaborate with internal tea
mbers and contribute to best practice improvements

• Mentor junior consultants and support their development where applicable



Skills and Experience

• 3+ years’ experience in AML/CTF compliance, risk, audit or consulting roles

• Excellent spoken and written English

• Strong understanding of AML/CTF frameworks in Australia and/or New Zealand

• High attention to detail and analytical thinking

• Confidence engaging with stakeholders and managing client relationships remotely

• A relevant degree or qualification

• An AML/CTF certification (e.g. CAMS, CFCS) is preferred but not essential

• Experience in a consulting or client-facing environment is highly regarded



About the Company

We are a specialist AML consultancy providing audit and advisory services to clients across Australia, New Zealand, and the UK. Our clients include organisations in the legal, crypto, accounting, financial services, and real estate sectors. Operating as a remote-first business, we welcome professionals based in the Philippines who are looking to apply their expertise in an international consultancy environment.



Why Join Us?

We’re building a culture based on trust, accountability, and collaboration. As a growing team, we encourage you to contribute ideas, take ownership of your work, and help shape the future of the business. You’ll be supported by an experienced leadership team and given the flexibility to thrive in a remote working environment.

title: [Quick Placement] Reliable VA Receptionist Full Time Remote
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Financial & Business Operations Associate (Part-Time )
description:
Part-Time | Growth-Oriented Venture Role



Job Overview



Capacity: 8–10 hours per week initially



Location: Primarily remote (Philippines-based)



Travel: Occasional domestic site visits (expenses covered)



Focus: Venture evaluation, operational structuring, and international coordination



About the Role



I am building and testing several early-stage business initiatives in the Philippines and am seeking a sharp, analytical professional to help evaluate and structure them.



This is not a standard bookkeeping role. This is a venture evaluation and operations role for someone who wants to understand how businesses are tested, improved, and scaled from the ground up.



The initial assignment involves evaluating a small agricultural venture in the Visayas-Mindanao region. There are minimal formal records in place.



Your task will be to determine:



Is this venture economically viable?



What are the true unit economics and cost drivers?



Should we scale, improve, pivot, or discontinue the project?



Growth Pathway



Beyond the initial farm project, responsibilities may expand into:



Designing structured market research systems for U.S. companies studying emerging Southeast Asian consumers



Organizing workflows and validation processes for AI-driven initiatives



Synthesizing field data into clear reports for U.S.-based stakeholders



Building repeatable frameworks for evaluating early-stage ventures



What You’ll Do



Conduct site visits and convert physical operations into structured financial data



Build simple, practical tracking systems (ClickUp or similar tools are a plus)



Analyze margins, cost drivers, and sustainability



Provide clear, direct recommendations on project viability



Coordinate research and validate information for new initiatives



Work independently and communicate findings concisely



Who This Role Suits



You may be a strong fit if you:



Have a degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business (CPA welcome but not required)



Think analytically and enjoy solving ambiguous problems



Are comfortable working independently



Communicate clearly across different types of stakeholders



Are curious about international business and technology



Fluency in Cebuano or Surigaonon is an advantage for field work but not required.



Compensation & Location



Philippines-based applicants only



Cebu, Davao, and Visayas/Mindanao candidates preferred for ease of travel



Primarily remote, with occasional site visits (expenses covered)



Compensation is project-based and aligned with an early-stage growth role.

Please include your expected hourly rate in your application.



How to Apply



 

 with:



Your resume



Your location



Your expected hourly rate



A short paragraph explaining why early-stage business evaluation interests you.

title: HIPAA CERTIFIED EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT!
description:
The Executive Assistant will serve as a **professional and personal support partner**, managing daily administrative tasks, coordinating communications, and assisting in both clinical and personal matters. This role requires someone who is **emotionally intelligent, organized, and comfortable interacting with American clients and families** in a compassionate yet professional manner..



## Key Responsibilities

**Administrative & Executive Support**

- Manage the client’s calendar, appointments, and therapy sessions.

- Draft, organize, and maintain confidential client records in compliance with **HIPAA** standards.

- Handle
 management — sorting, prioritizing, and drafting responses when needed.

- Support with documentation, report preparation, and data entry related to therapy sessions.

- Coordinate communication between families, agencies, and other professionals.



**Client & Interview Coordination**

- Schedule and conduct intake or follow-up calls with clients and families as needed.

- Confidently interview American families, caregivers, or professionals to gather essential information.

- Ensure interactions reflect empathy, professionalism, and understanding of special needs contexts.



**Personal Assistance**

- Assist the client with personal and lifestyle management tasks (e.g., scheduling personal appointments, reminders, travel coordination).

- Help organize digital and personal files for improved efficiency.

- Provide overall day-to-day support to streamline the client’s professional and personal workflow.



## Requirements



- Background in **psychology, social work, or behavioral sciences** (preferred).

- Experience as an **Executive Assistant**, **Administrative Coordinator**, or **Client Relations Specialist**.

- Strong understanding of **HIPAA compliance** and confidentiality practices.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills; comfortable speaking with American clients.

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and emotionally intelligent.

- Proficient with online scheduling, documentation, and communication tools.



Kindly send your updated CV along with a 1-2min self intro to proceed. Thank you!

title: Client Success Manager (CSM)
description:

We are hiring a proactive, confident, and highly organized Client Success Manager to help our agents succeed with our lead programs while ensuring long-term retention and client satisfaction.



This is NOT a basic support role.



You will act as a strategic partner to our clients — guiding expectations, solving problems, increasing performance, and helping agents stay committed to the program long-term.

Communication Skills (CRITICAL)

 Messaging



 Communication

Confident



Direct (without being confrontational).



Strong English fluency is required.

title: Content Manager: Social Media & Web (WordPress + Elementor)
description:
We're not looking for someone who's "pretty good." We need someone who's obsessive about details.



The kind of person who notices when an image is 2 pixels off. Who reads a caption four times before hitting publish. Who finds typos that spell-check misses. If you've been called "picky" or "perfectionist" before—and you took it as a compliment—keep reading.



What You'll Actually Be Doing



Right now, we have two core needs. More will come as you grow with us.



1. Social Media Scheduling in 



Upload posts across Instagram,
, GMB, X, and Pinterest. Add images, captions, alt tags—and make sure everything is polished before it goes live. You'll work inside Sprout Social, which handles all platforms in one place. If you haven't used Sprout, we'll train you. And the skills will make you more marketable if we ever part ways.



2. Web Content in WordPress + Elementor



Place content on pages. Follow our standards for styling, spacing, image handling, and metadata. You’ll also create and categorize pages intelligently. If you've used Elementor before, great. If not, we'll train you—but you need to be comfortable in WordPress already. You do not need to be a designer, but you need to know if something looks good or not. 



That's the work. It's repetitive. It requires focus. And it must be nearly error-free because our clients have zero tolerance for sloppy presentation. We're saying that out loud so you can self-select. If you thrive on variety and hate repeating tasks, or you’re just looking for something to pay you, this isn't for you.



Vital info: In your application, use this phrase somewhere so we know you actually read this: "detail-driven"



We expect general competencies in typing, Google Workspace, Gmail, Google Drive, and all of the other Google Apps. We also expect you to be self-managed and proactive. You should expect that out of yourself as well. 



You may have other VA-type tasks assigned to you as well. We may even need some assistance with AI in writing and running assessments and checks. Have a background in SEO or design? Let us know!



Who We're Hoping to Find



We realize our budget is entry-level. We're not hiding that. What we offer in exchange: real training, meaningful work, and a long-term home if you're the COMMITTED kind of person who grows with the companies you join. We've built this agency on relationships, not revolving doors. If you’re younger and getting going, come aboard. If you’re more experienced but without work, read on…



So who fits?



• A social media manager who wants hands-on experience with Sprout and a more technical workflow.

• A web designer or WordPress builder who wants more exposure to other areas of digital marketing and content strategy.

• A VA or data entry professional looking to level up into WordPress, Elementor, and real marketing projects.

• A project manager or strategist between gigs who wants to get your foot in the door and prove your skills—even if the starting rate is lower than you'd normally take. Come show your value and we may have another place for you. 



If you're motivated, reliable, and obsessively detail-oriented? We want to hear from you.



Requirements

• Equipped with a reliable computer and stable internet connection

• Able to meet via video call 2–3x per week with management (up to 5 the first few weeks)

• Willing to produce brief daily reports in our time-tracking software

• Comfortable learning new industry-leading online tools (we'll train the right person)

• Available 4–8 hours per day, consistently (you can let us know what works for you)



Compensation



USD $3-$4/hour depending on experience (starting). We pay bi-weekly initially to get you some fuel and build trust for the 1st three pay periods and monthly thereafter. There's room to grow as you prove yourself—this is meant to be a long-term fit, not a quick gig.



Want a Long-Term Career?



We take our investments in our partners seriously. Ideally, we’d like this to work ou,t and you continue without agency. Here’s how it works:



We Dance, We Date, We Marry: All independent contractors entering our organization enter into a probationary period of one month, followed by three months (minimum) before we commit to anything longer. We operate in this manner to determine fit, climate/cultural countenance, and to ensure you are in “the right seat on the bus.”



To Apply



Do not reply here with a generic message. We will not respond.



Instead:



Submit your application via this form: 



Then reply here to confirm you submitted the form.



If you only reply here without using the form, your application won't be considered. You’d be amazed at how many people on here don’t follow directions and keep following up.  



Thanks!

description:
Seeking the correct person for the right fit.... however that works for both of us, we are open: Full-time, part-time, or even project-based. 



UPDATE: Primarily looking for a full-time, focused individual who is seeking stable, long-term employment. We're not seeking rabbit chasers, 



We have a small and focused marketing agency that works for a few products and personal brands. We need a skilled editor who is also an artist... 



You have high competency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, and the Adobe Suite... as well as the technicalities of video production, media sizes, audio clean-up, etc. We find the best post-production creatives typically play in many areas, such as photography, design, motion, drawing, painting, etc. Share your passions for us to have a great sense of who you are. 



Ideally, you have a strong portfolio in animation and a good sense of graphic design principles. And you know how to manage files in a professional workflow.



And most of all, you are intuitive and versatile. You know that millisecond when to cut between words... You know how to select an appropriate stock b-roll clip and can choose a song to match the objective. You LOVE having all the tools with flexibility for your creativity to flourish, yet you have a solid track record of moving projects to completion. 



If you primarily stick to lighter tools such as Canva and phone app-based editing programs, we're not a fit. We'll be asking about your computer's specs, your upload speed, and other requirements for more experienced designers. If you also know when and how to use them 



Show us your best work. Looking for portfolios with both animation and editing, but open to people who may have a specialization in one or the other. In terms of animation and design style, our initial project will be with simple, minimal graphics that are intelligently orchestrated with philosophical insights. 



All applicants who we feel may be a fit will be hired for 1-3 paid test projects. We'll invest in seeing if we are a fit because we are determining how much project management and input we'll need to have in the early stages. Ideally, we're looking for someone who wants to grow and evolve with our unique, potent, growing agency for many years. If you're a proactive self-starter who "gets it," write us. 



If you have a friend or two you love working with, we're also open to hiring a team. Pay will be determined on your competency, productivity, and overall efficiency. We are rapidly expanding in video production, so there is an opportunity to start part-time and grow into something greater. 



To Apply: Prepare your portfolio and info. Then follow the instructions below. 



1) You must submit your application via this link: 





2) Reply here to notify us that you've submitted. Note: if you only reply here, you will not get a response and your application won't be considered. We will reply to each applicant who uses the form and let you know if we see you as a fit now or in the future.

title: Amazon Account Manager (Amazon VA) | Remote Work | Immediate Hire
description:
Job Purpose 

The Amazon Account Manager (Remote work position) will be a key member of the team, seeking to work for a growing digital marketing agency. This role provides administrative, operational, and Seller Central support to help drive the growth of Black Compass Digital’s business and its clients. This role will be a partner to the stakeholders by providing quality, transparent and meaningful reporting and analyses to support key business decisions. This is a full time job with the expectations of working 40 hours per week.



*This role at the start will be in Philippine Time Zone Hours: 9PM - 5:00AM (Graveyard Shift)

**Needs to attend daily meeting at 8:30AM

***You will not have to talk to clients.

****Experience in Amazon Seller Central is mandatory.

***** This is a quick hire - we are looking to fulfill this position ASAP



Key Responsibilities

•    Collaborate with Senior Marketing Analyst and Head of Strategy to execute on company KPIs

 •       Monitor and kick of hijackers / copycats on listings

 •       Reporting to Brand Registry

 •       Account Health monitoring

 •       Troubleshooting problems on Seller Central

 •       Listing management

 •    Weekly and monthly reporting to provide trends and insights on our clients

 •    Curated reporting for clients to demonstrate strong support and affirmative actions

 •    Excel based reporting and analysis

 •    Admin tasks

 •    Ad hoc tasks, as necessary



Preferred Skills and Qualities:

Strong understanding of Amazon Seller Central tools and processes.

Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time-management skills.

Effective communicator, both written and verbal.

Proactive problem-solver with a customer-focused mindset.

Ability to manage multiple accounts and tasks simultaneously.



Benefits:

- 5 Days’ Vacation Paid Time Off

- Time Off For 9 National PH Holidays

- Company Events – Free Dinner

- Year End Bonus – We Pay 1% of Company Profits To Our Employees



SECTION 1

1. Please confirm your understanding by inserting BCD into your subject line response.

2. Please confirm in the first sentence of your body that you are willing to take a 40 – 60 minute test

3. Please provide your resume

)

I'm looking for a full time video editor who can turn my great content into beautiful and engaging captioned shorts, and to post my content regularly in my Instagram and

Thank you so much!

title: Amazon PPC Specialist
description:
About the Role:

We're looking for a highly experienced Amazon PPC Specialist to join our growing team. In this role, you'll take ownership of the day-to-day ad management for multiple Amazon seller accounts - including strategy, campaign builds, bid optimization, reporting, and ongoing performance improvement.



You'll work closely with our account team to execute on client goals, join client calls to provide expert insight, and collaborate on strategic roadmaps to drive growth.



Internship / Trial Period:

This position will begin with a paid 60-day internship (trial period) to ensure mutual fit. During this time, you will receive compensation while demonstrating your skills, adapting to the role, and integrating with the team. At the end of the 60 days, your performance will be reviewed. Successful candidates will transition to a full-time role under a standard employment agreement.



What You’ll Do:

* Manage Amazon PPC campaigns across multiple accounts (Sponsored Products, Brands, Display).

* Perform ongoing keyword research and bid management.

* Build and optimize campaigns using flat files and internal tools.

* Monitor performance, analyze reports, and create custom reporting dashboards.

* Collaborate with account managers to align PPC strategy with client business goals.

* Join client calls as needed to provide PPC updates and answer questions.

* Proactively identify opportunities to improve results and reduce wasted spend.



What We’re Looking For:

* 3+ years of experience managing Amazon PPC campaigns (agency experience preferred).

* Proven ability to manage multiple accounts and prioritize effectively.

* Strong understanding of Amazon Ads, keyword strategy, campaign structure, and optimization best practices.

* Proficiency with reporting tools, keyword research platforms, and flat files.

* Exceptional English communication skills (verbal and written) — this is a client-facing role.

* High level of organization, attention to detail, and accountability.



Bonus Points For Experience With:

* Amazon DSP

* Amazon Marketing Cloud (AMC)

* Google Data Studio (Looker Studio).

* AI prompting and automation tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Scale Insights, or similar).



If you're interested, please don't forget to attach your updated CV in PDF format.

title: Client Success Manager
description:
About XP Strategy

XP Strategy is an Amazon Ads Verified Partner agency founded by Abe Chomali. Since 2016, we've helped hundreds of brands and sellers scale profitably on Amazon through data-driven advertising and strategic account management. Our team works across a wide range of categories and account sizes - from emerging brands to established multi-ASIN portfolios.



We believe that great results start with great communication and strong organization. Our culture emphasizes transparency, ownership, and collaboration - every tea
mber plays a vital role in creating success for our clients.



Why Join XP Strategy

At XP Strategy, you’ll join a results-oriented, collaborative team that values clarity, accountability, and growth. You’ll work directly with clients who trust our expertise, while collaborating closely with experienced PPC specialists who deliver world-class results.



If you thrive on organization, communication, and helping clients win — we’d love to meet you.



The Role

The Client Success Manager (CSM) is the bridge between XP Strategy’s internal PPC team our clients. This role ensures that communication, expectations, and performance stay aligned across all active accounts. You’ll act as the client’s primary point of contact, translating goals and insights into clear tasks for the PPC team, tracking progress, and ensuring timely delivery of results.



This position is ideal for someone with solid Amazon PPC knowledge who enjoys building relationships, managing projects, and keeping teams organized and accountable.



Key Responsibilities

* Serve as the main point of contact for assigned clients, managing ongoing communication and updates.

* Coordinate work between internal PPC specialists and client teams, ensuring clarity on goals, timelines, and deliverables.

* Review PPC reports and performance data to translate insights into next steps or strategic recommendations.

* Track milestones, deadlines, and recurring tasks through ClickUp or similar project management systems.

* Lead or join client calls to provide updates, gather feedback, and maintain strong client relationships.

* Identify potential issues early and proactively work with the team to resolve them.

* Maintain organized account documentation and communication logs.

* Support the continuous improvement of client onboarding and retention processes.



Qualifications

* 2+ years of experience in Amazon PPC or e-commerce account management (agency experience preferred).

* Strong understanding of Amazon Ads metrics and campaign structures.

* Exceptional communication and organization skills - must be comfortable managing multiple accounts and priorities.

* Ability to analyze data and communicate insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

* High level of professionalism and responsiveness in client interactions.

* Comfortable working independently in a remote, fast-moving team environment.



Preferred / Nice-to-Have

* Amazon Seller Central / Campaign Manager

* Helium 10, AdLabs, Data Dive, or similar analytics tools

* ClickUp or comparable project management platforms

* Looker Studio (Google Data Studio)

* Slack, Zoom, and other remote communication tools



If you're interested, please don't forget to attach your updated CV in PDF format.

title: Web Designer & Page Builder (WordPress + AI Tools)
description:
We're a growing US-based digital marketing agency that builds websites and runs SEO for home service contractors (HVAC, roofing, plumbing, electrical). We need a sharp web designer/page builder who can take AI-generated pages from about 90% to 100% — that last 10% where a real human eye makes the difference.

What You'll Be Doing:



Building out service pages and location pages on WordPress using page builders (Elementor, Divi, or similar)

Working inside 
v (an AI web development tool) to generate and refine pages — you don't need to know it yet, but you need to be tech-savvy enough to learn it fast

Taking rough wireframes, reference sites, or verbal direction and turning them into clean, professional pages that convert

Matching and maintaining brand consistency across multiple client websites

Making design tweaks, spacing adjustments, font/color refinements — the small stuff that separates amateur sites from professional ones

Light image editing (cropping, resizing, basic Canva or Photoshop work for hero images and graphics)

Communicating progress daily and flagging issues before they become problems



What We're Looking For:



2+ years of experience building WordPress websites (send examples or portfolio links — no portfolio = automatic no)

Strong visual design sense — you notice when padding is off, fonts don't match, or a layout feels wrong

Comfortable learning new AI tools quickly (
v, ChatGPT, Claude, etc.)

Reliable internet and a professional work setup

Able to work US business hours (Eastern Time) or have significant overlap

Detail-oriented and self-motivated — you don't need to be micromanaged

Good written English communication



Bonus (Not Required):



Experience with Elementor, Divi, or Bricks Builder

Basic understanding of SEO (page structure, heading hierarchy, internal linking)

Canva or Photoshop skills

Experience working with US-based agencies or clients



About Us:

We're a small but growing agency (RAM Digital) focused on getting real results for contractors. We use AI tools heavily to move fast, but we know that AI alone doesn't produce great work — it takes a skilled human to polish it. If you're the kind of person who cares about the details and takes pride in clean, professional design work, we want to hear from you.

This is a long-term position with room to grow as we scale.



?? HOW TO APPLY (READ THIS — applications that skip this step will be ignored):



Start your application with the word "BLUEPRINT" so we know you read the full post

Include a link to 2-3 websites you've personally built or designed (not agency portfolios — YOUR work)

Tell us in 2-3 sentences: What's the #1 thing most WordPress sites get wrong visually, and how do you fix it?

title: Technical Content Lead
description:
TECHNICAL CONTENT LEAD

(Title doesn’t matter. Impact does.)



There’s a specific kind of person we’re looking for.

Not just a writer.

Not just a developer.

Someone who has lived through WordPress.



You’ve built the late-night client sites.

You’ve wrestled with Elementor layouts that broke for no reason.

You’ve refreshed a dashboard and held your breath after updating plugins.

You’ve migrated hosts, cleaned hacked installs, debugged WooCommerce checkout chaos.



And somewhere along the way… you started writing about it.



Maybe it was a blog.

Maybe Medium.

Maybe just long Reddit replies where you explained things better than the official documentation ever did.



And you realized something:



You’re not just good at building things.

You’re good at explaining them.



You can take something technical, messy, and overwhelming…

and make it feel simple. Human. Clear.



If you’re reading this and thinking,

“Wait. That’s literally me.”

Keep reading.





WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS



SGEN is building something better.



But here’s the truth:



It doesn’t matter how good a product is if no one understands it.

We need someone who makes SGEN understandable to the outside world.



When someone Googles a question at 1:14 AM — frustrated, stuck, ready to quit —

 they shouldn’t find silence.



They should find you.



Clear answers.

Honest comparisons.

Step-by-step guidance.

A voice that sounds like a smart friend, not a corporate manual.



You are the bridge between complexity and clarity.



WHO YOU ARE



You’re naturally curious.

If something doesn’t have documentation, you don’t wait to be assigned. You fix it.



You open a product and instinctively think:

“This needs a getting-started guide.”

“That error message needs explaining.”

“New users will get stuck here.”



You remember what it felt like to not know what a CMS was.



And when you explain it, you don’t use jargon.

You don’t flex vocabulary.

You just make it make sense.



Your writing feels like a conversation over coffee.

Not stiff.

Not robotic.

Not AI-generated.

Just clear.



YOU HAVE OPINIONS (AND THAT'S GOOD)



You probably have thoughts about WordPress architecture.



You might love it.

You might be tired of it.

You definitely have stories.



We don’t need neutral.

We don’t need safe.



We need someone who can say:

“Here’s why this is broken.”

“Here’s why this is better.”

“And here’s where we still need to improve.”



Fair. Honest. Confident.



Not loud. Not defensive.



Just grounded in real experience.



YOU'RE NOT FRAGILE ONLINE



Reddit can be brutal.



Blog comments can be snarky.



Someone will say:

“SGEN is just another startup that’ll be dead in a year.”



You don’t panic.

You don’t rage-reply.

You don’t disappear.

You respond with clarity and calm.



Because you know the difference between criticism and noise.



WHAT YOU'LL ACTUALLY DO



You’ll dive deep into SGEN.



You’ll build test sites. Break things. Explore edges.



You’ll document:

- The first-click experience

- The confusing parts

- The missing explanations

- The friction



Then you’ll write:



Clear documentation.

Step 1. Step 2. Screenshot. Expected result.



Blog posts that actually say something.

Not filler. Not fluff. Not SEO sludge.



Comparison pages that feel honest.

Guides that prevent support tickets.

Reddit answers that genuinely help someone.



You’ll publish consistently. Weekly. Reliably.

Because content works through rhythm, not bursts.



WHAT MATTERS MOST

Native-level written English.

Not technically correct — natural.



When someone in the US reads your writing, they shouldn’t think,

“Oh, this was written overseas.”



They should think,

“This person gets it.”



You’ve built WordPress sites for at least 2 years.

Not theory. Not tutorials. Real clients. Real mess.



You understand:

- Plugin conflicts

- Theme weirdness

- Hosting nightmares

- Security scares



And when you write about them, it’s fro
mory — not Google.



You can write both:

- A bold opinion piece

 and

- A precise technical guide.



You understand basic SEO — not in a spammy way, but structurally.

You know what helps content rank without making it unreadable.



You can screenshot. Screen record. Annotate.

Because visual tools deserve visual documentation.



And most importantly:



You edit yourself.



You don’t ship first drafts.



You refine. Tighten. Clarify. Simplify.



THIS IS PROBABLY YOU IF...

- You’ve written long Reddit answers “just to help.”

- You’ve explained technical concepts to non-technical clients without making them feel dumb.

- You secretly enjoy reorganizing messy documentation.

- You get frustrated when products don’t explain themselves properly.

- You’ve thought, “I could write this better.”



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



This is not generic content writing.

This is not keyword stuffing.

This is not pumping out 1,500 words of fluff twice a week.



We’re not looking for a writer who Googles technical topics.



We’re looking for a technical person who writes.



WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS



Great content doesn’t just bring traffic.

It builds trust.



It reduces support tickets.

It converts skeptics.

It makes a product feel mature.



A mediocre hire in this role will quietly weaken the brand.

The right hire will compound value every single week.



Are you the one we're looking for?

 your resume and portfolio to "phhr at seoguarantee dot com" with the subject line: Your Name – Technical Content Lead at Your Service.



COMPENSATION

For the right person in the Philippines with real WordPress experience and strong US-facing writing ability, this role ranges roughly from $1,200–$2,500 USD/month, depending on depth of experience and portfolio quality.



We will not underpay for excellence.



Because excellent content pays for itself.



If you’re reading this and thinking:

“They just described my career path.”

title: UI UX Designer
description:
Must use 15 apply points to apply.



About Us

We are a digital marketing agency based in the US specializing in SEO, Google Ads, and
 Ads for clients in the construction, security, and real estate industries. We are a small, tight-knit team that values quality over quantity, clear communication, and people who take ownership of their work.



The Role

We are looking for a full-time website and page designer to own the visual design layer across all of our clients. Everything that goes on a client’s website starts with your design in Figma. You will be the person responsible for how every client’s website and strategic pages look before they go to development.



This is a dedicated, full-time position. We are not looking for freelancers juggling multiple clients. We need someone who is fully committed to our team and available during working hours.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Website design for all clients — homepage redesigns, new website builds, landing page designs, and any other page design work. All designs live in Figma.

• Strategic page design — pillar pages, service pages, and city/geo landing pages. These are high-impact pages that drive SEO rankings and conversions. You will create design templates per client for each page type so new pages can be produced efficiently while staying visually consistent.

• Design QA — after the developer builds your designs, you review the live build against your Figma to make sure everything matches. You catch what’s off before it goes live.

• Conversion optimization — you design with conversions in mind. CTA placement, visual hierarchy, form positioning, and trust signals. When data shows a page isn’t converting, you’ll adjust the design based on what the SEO strategist flags.

• Social media graphics — static post designs for client social media accounts. Consistent brand design across platforms.

• Collaboration — you’ll work closely with our content writer, SEO strategist, and developer. Communication happens in Slack and you’re expected to be responsive during working hours.

Requirements

• Proficient in Figma — this is our primary design tool. Everything you create lives here.

• Website design experience — you understand layout, spacing, typography, and how to design pages that look professional and convert visitors into leads.

• Mobile-first design — every design must account for both desktop and mobile. This is non-negotiable.

• Attention to detail — pixel-level precision matters. When you hand off a design to development, it should be clean and complete.

• Strong communication — you respond promptly in Slack, ask questions when something is unclear, and flag issues before they become problems.

• Reliable and consistent — you show up, you meet deadlines, and you don’t need to be chased for updates.

• Able to take direction and also think independently — we’ll give you briefs and feedback, but we also want you to bring your own design perspective and speak up when you see something that could be better.



Nice to Have

• Experience designing for WordPress or Elementor-based websites

• Understanding of basic SEO principles (headings, CTAs, page structure)

• Experience creating infographics or data visualizations

• Familiarity with brand identity and style guide creation



What We Offer

• Fixed monthly salary — no tracking hours, no guessing what your paycheck will be. Stable, predictable income every month.

• Long-term position — we are not hiring for a project. We want someone who grows with the team.

• Clear role and ownership — you own the design layer across every client. Your work is valued and visible.

• Small team, real impact — you’re not a number. Your input matters and your work directly affects our clients’ results.

• Room to grow — as we expand social media and take on new clients, your role and responsibilities will grow with the agency.



How to Apply

Do not send your resume as I am not interested in that but your work. 



• A link to your portfolio or Figma projects showing website design work (not just logos or social media graphics — we need to see full page designs)

• A brief message telling us about your experience and why you’re a good fit

• Your availability to start



Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

title: Australian GST Bookkeeper – Xero Reconciliation Project (Partnership + Company)
description:
I'm an Australian business owner looking for an experienced Xero bookkeeper with strong knowledge of the Australian tax system to reconcile 18 months of transactions across two separate entities — a partnership (tied to a personal ABN) and a Pty Ltd company. Both entities are GST registered and operate in professional services.

This is a project-based role with a clear path to regular ongoing work if you do a great job.



The Scope

The company generates roughly 5–10 transactions per day. The partnership generates 1–3 per day. Neither entity has been reconciled — we're starting from scratch across approximately 18 months. In total you're likely looking at 3,000–5,000+ transactions across both files.

Your job is to get both Xero files clean, correctly categorised, and ready for my BAS agent to review and lodge. You do not need to lodge anything yourself.



Specifically you will:



Reconcile all bank transactions across both Xero entities from the start

Categorise expenses to the correct accounts using the right Australian chart of accounts

Apply correct GST tax codes (GST, GST-free, BAS excluded, input-taxed) to all transactions

Proactively identify and flag legitimate business expenses that can be claimed — I want to make sure nothing is missed

Flag any transactions you're unsure about so I can clarify — I'm available for questions throughout

Deliver both files in a state where my BAS agent can go straight to lodgement without cleaning up behind you



What I'm Looking For



Minimum 3 years experience bookkeeping for Australian clients or working within an Australian accounting firm or BPO

Deep understanding of Australian GST — not just how to apply codes, but knowing what's claimable and what isn't for a professional services business

Xero proficient — bank reconciliation, tax codes, chart of accounts, and working across multiple separate organisations

Someone who works independently but communicates clearly when they have questions

Detail-oriented — I'd rather you ask than guess



Screening Question — Required

Applications without this will not be considered.

In your own words, explain: what is GST, how does it apply to a registered Australian business, and what is a BAS? Also briefly describe how you would approach reconciling a Xero file that has had no reconciliation done from the start.



To Apply Include:



Your CV with specific Australian clients or firms you've worked with

Your answer to the screening question above

Your proposed project rate (fixed fee preferred, or hourly with an estimated total)

Your availability and how quickly you could start





What Happens After You Apply

Shortlisted candidates will be given a small paid test task — approximately 20–30 sample transactions to categorise. This is paid and takes around 30–60 minutes. It's the fastest way for both of us to know if it's a good fit before committing to the full project.

Strong performers on this project will be offered regular ongoing bookkeeping work.

title: ADMIN EXECUTIVE (B2B, WATSONS, GUARDIAN, WELCIA, BIGSELLER, URSTORE)
description:
Join our team as part of a dynamic, global team of 40 across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines. 

In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of Korean brands such as Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir and other top of trend Korean brands.

We are looking for a driven, and detail-oriented tea
mber to support our brand’s growth across digital and offline channels. You will play a key role in processing POs, coordinating marketing campaigns, managing events, and driving strategies that connect with our beauty brand presence.



Key Responsibilities:



- Work closely with the Channel Lead Manager to support marketing initiatives for key retail accounts (e.g., Watsons, Guardian, DONKI etc.).

- Regularly check the B2B portal system and compile new Purchase Orders (POs).

- Perform data entry of PO details into the internal databases.

- Monitor PO fulfillment and non-fulfillment status.

- Generate Sales Orders in the Bigseller or Urstore and create corresponding Delivery Order forms.

- Coordinate with the warehouse team for all Purchase Orders.

- Support the end-to-end execution of offline activation events, including preparation of marketing collaterals, ensure timely delivery and accuracy of all promotional content across platforms.

- Coordinate new product launches and ensure smooth operations for stock replenishment, product creation, and promotion setups.

- Organize and maintain critical documents, contracts, and records related to channel activities.

- Assist in planning and executing effective marketing campaigns aligned with brand strategy and objectives.

- Collaborate with other departments for adhoc tasks.



Qualifications:

- at least 1-3 relevant working experience in channel admin, trade admin, or any related field.

- Proficient in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables).

- Experience working in the retail, Korean brands retail, marketing, B2B or ecommerce sector.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel opportunity in Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you

title: Job Application Specialist
description:
Description:

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help submit job applications on our behalf each week. Your primary task will be to apply to 50 targeted job openings per week using the materials and instructions we provide.



Half of the applications will be in the healthcare industry, and the other half will be in technology or finance. We will provide clear instructions, job role details, resume versions, and target companies for each category — your role is to execute accurately, consistently, and on time.



This position is ideal for someone who is dependable, efficient, and comfortable managing repetitive but important administrative work with precision.



Responsibilities:



Apply to 50 jobs per week following detailed instructions and templates



Use multiple resumes and cover letters depending on the role and industry



Maintain an organized record of all applications in a shared Google Sheet



Submit weekly reports summarizing activity and progress



Research new opportunities and job listings that fit provided criteria (optional but a plus)



Requirements:



Excellent written and spoken English



Strong attention to detail and ability to follow instructions carefully



Proficient with Google Sheets, Google Drive, and web-based applications



Reliable internet connection and consistent communication



Prior experience submitting job applications or doing administrative VA work preferred



Basic familiarity with healthcare, technology, or finance roles is a plus



Schedule & Work Expectations:



Flexible schedule — work anytime as long as weekly goals are met



Expected workload: approximately 8–12 hours per week



Must meet the target of 50 completed applications per week



Provide a weekly summary report every Friday



Compensation:



Fixed weekly rate based on performance and accuracy



Bonuses available for consistency and exceptional work quality



How to Apply:



Please submit:



A short introduction about yourself and your experience as a virtual assistant



Any experience you have with job applications, data entry, or recruiting tasks



A link or attachment to a sample spreadsheet you’ve created or managed

title: Assistant & Automation Operations Manager (GoHighLevel Expert)
description:
We are a growing Florida, U.S.-based Property & Casualty insurance agency (home, flood, auto) looking for a highly skilled GoHighLevel & Automation expert to oversee and optimize our backend systems. Also keep track of my
 inbox and keep my team who does quoting organized. The ability to respond on my
 inbox on behalf as me as well. 



This is NOT a basic VA role. We are looking for someone who can think strategically, improve workflows, and help scale operations through CRM automation. And being detail oriented. 



Responsibilities:



• Manage and optimize GoHighLevel pipelines, workflows, and tagging

• Integrate Zapier and AM Cards for automated thank-you card campaigns after policy closes (cross-sell opportunities for auto insurance)

• Maintain CRM organization and data cleanliness

• Track referral sources and build automation for partner follow-ups

• Continuously improve backend systems and automation



Requirements:



• Strong GoHighLevel experience (required)

• Experience with Zapier and automation tools

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Strong written English (must match owner’s tone) - we can pay for an AI
 system to make your life easier too. 

• Ability to think independently and improve systems

Good phone call skills when needed - not too strong of an accent. You may make a call here or there. 



Our goal is to build strong backend systems so the owner can focus on meetings, partnerships, and revenue growth.

title: Marketing Video Editor & Designer
description:
The ideal candidate will:

*Show competency in videography principles from scripting through final editing and show proficiency with branding guidelines using Adobe CS and video motion software such as Premier Pro, Motion, and/or After Effects, Premiere and Final Cut Pro in an Apple Mac environment.

*Pre-visualize and/or storyboard shot ideas based on scripts or project outlines.

*Perform non-linear editing using Final Cut or Adobe Premiere software and designs after effects as needed including motion graphics, layout, and animation

*Be able to select and use music to match the tone and style of the episode and story

*Be able to create various types of audio / video to tell stories across multiple platforms

*Be able to mix different media into a complete experience (video, graphics, music).

*Experience in typography, color, composition, compositing, key framing, and title design.

*Be detail-oriented and possess a sophisticated editing style

*Knowledge of social media and how to engage audiences on digital platforms in the public space is essential to this role

*Ability to work with a team directly in edit sessions to assess needs and meet project requirements.

*Properly maintain a digital archive

*Possess a strong attention to detail and time managements skills, and be an organized team player

*Have experience working in a fast-paced environment on weekly deadlines

*Demonstrate a solid typing WPM (ideally 45 wpm+)

*provide their own video and audio equipment



Job responsibilities include:

*Advise and coach the team on lighting, audio and video requirements to ensure quality footage for use in post-production

*Manage our podcast production schedule for Rosie Radio, including managing workflow; and capture, editing, and uploading of podcasts to various online channels (iTunes [Libsyn], YouTube, blog, etc)

*Play a highly collaborative creative role in structuring new ideas and managing production projects to completion

*Edit online content for YouTube and 
, including podcast episodes, storytelling videos, and how-to videos

*Create and produce marketing videos and PR videos, as needed

*Sourcing photos, stock video and audio as needed for projects

*Create all multimedia content for social (audio / video / design)

*Edit and upload footage and maintain video logs and media storage

*Create motion graphics for video

*Design online / social graphics for various projects



Qualifications

*Well-versed in Adobe Premiere, along with the rest of Adobe CC software (After Effects, Photoshop, etc)

*Experience creating media for social and the web

*Experience in storytelling via videography

*Knowledge of video codecs and encoding software

*Expertise with multicam editing

*A strong understanding of editing workflows and file structuring

*Ability to color correct and mix audio

*Knowledge and experience with video lighting and basic set setup



Tech Requirements:

Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

Need to have professional editing software (Licensed Adobe Premiere)



Work core hours are from Sunday - Thursday 3PM - 7PM CST // Monday - Friday 5AM - 9AM PH Time



This is a PART-TIME role with a salary range of PHP28,000 -38,000 monthly,



Application Instruction:

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagnnlBbUosheImMK/form
