Manage
/Instagram ad campaigns driving traffic to our VSL funnels

Monitor performance across all ad accounts (currently spending 2?3K/day, scaling to 5K+)

Optimize bids, budgets, audiences, and placements to hit 3.5x+ ROAS targets

Make real-time decisions: pause underperformers, scale winners, test new angles



Strategic Testing (Weekly)

Launch 1-2 new audience tests weekly (cold, lookalike, interest-based)

Collaborate with our Content Director on creative A/B tests (hooks, angles, formats)

Run landing page optimization experiments with our Copywriter

Document learnings and build our "growth playbook"

Funnel Optimization (Ongoing)

Analyze the full VSL funnel (ad ? VSL page ? application ? sales call ? customer)

Identify drop-off points and collaborate cross-functionally to improve conversion rates

Use data to inform creative briefs, landing page iterations, and offer positioning



Scaling (As Performance Allows)

Identify campaigns ready to scale based on consistency and profitability

Implement gradual budget increases while maintaining ROAS (our framework: +20% every 3 days if stable)

Manage risk during scaling—know when to scale aggressively vs conservatively



Reporting & Communication (2x Weekly)

Create Loom video updates (Tuesdays + Fridays) covering: what's working, what's not, why, and next steps

Maintain real-time performance dashboards

Present strategic recommendations in weekly team strategy calls

Translate data into insights that non-marketers can understand



What You Bring



Must-Haves (Non-Negotiable)



Experience:

2+ years hands-on experience managing
/Instagram ad campaigns (ideally for education, coaching, or info products)

Proven track record scaling campaigns to $3K+/day profitably

Deep understanding of VSL funnel mechanics (ad ? video ? application ? high-ticket sale)

Experience managing $50K+/month ad budgets with clear ROAS accountability



Technical Skills:

 Ads Manager mastery (campaign structure, pixel optimization, audience building)

Google Analytics proficiency (funnel analysis, conversion tracking)

A/B testing methodology (statistical significance, test design, documentation)

Basic funnel-building tools (ClickFunnels, Leadpages, or similar)

Data analysis in Google Sheets/Excel (pivot tables, cohort analysis, dashboards)



Analytical Mindset:

You live in data but don't drown in it—you find signal in noise

You understand creative + data synergy (not just "numbers person")

You can explain complex performance trends in simple terms

You make decisions based on evidence, not gut feel alone



Communication:

Crystal clear written communication (Slack, Loom, docs)

Comfortable on video (you'll record regular updates)

Async-first mindset (we're remote across timezones)

You can advocate for your ideas while staying collaborative



Cultural Fit:

High performance, zero drama - You deliver excellent work without creating friction. We have a strict "no brilliant jerks" policy.

Team-first mentality - You celebrate team wins over personal credit. Collaboration > ego, always.

Peaceful & Profitable believer - You've experienced burnout and reject hustle culture. You prove excellent results don't require 80-hour weeks.

Continuous learner - You're evolving constantly. You read, test, learn from failures, and level up relentlessly.

World-class standards - You refuse to ship mediocre work. Quality over quantity, every time.



Nice-to-Haves (Bonus Points)

Experience with YouTube, TikTok, or LinkedIn ads (we're expanding platforms)

Worked with Asian or global multicultural teams (you understand cross-cultural communication)

Built creative briefs for design/video teams (you know how to translate data into creative direction)

Experience in education, coaching, or "expert brand" niches (you get our audience)

Google Ads or native advertising experience (diversification opportunities)

Previous remote work experience (you know how to thrive async)



Why Market Leaders?



Peaceful & Profitable Culture

We mean it. No Slack messages at 2 AM expecting responses. No "always be hustling" toxicity. We build for decades, not quarters. You'll have clear work hours, real weekends, and a team that respects boundaries.



Remote-First, Truly

Work from anywhere in the Asia-Pacific timezone. We meet async via Slack and Loom, with key Zoom calls twice weekly. No micromanagement. We care about outcomes, not hours logged. Trust is our default.



Career Growth Path

Months 1-6: Master our VSL campaigns, scale to $5K+/day, become autonomous

Months 7-12: Own multi-channel strategy (YouTube, TikTok tests), scale to $10K+/day

Year 2+: Build and lead growth team as we scale, become Head of Growth, equity potential



Team & Retreats

You'll work with a small, mighty team: Bryan & Melvin (co-founders, 10+ years building together), Morgan (Content Director, creative genius), Collen (Copywriter, conversion expert), [Other tea
mbers]



Quarterly team retreats (3-4 days, rotating Asian locations—Thailand, Bali, Vietnam, etc.). Fully paid.



Compensation & Perks

Salary:
SGD

Quarterly Retreats: Fully covered (flights, accommodation, activities)

Work-from-Anywhere: As long as timezone overlap works

Equity Potential: For exceptional long-term tea
mbers (12+ months)



Apply Now!

title: Long-form Video Editor
description:
Who We Are







Market Leaders is on a mission to become a world-renowned coaching and marketing education brand by 2031. With Asian roots and global reach, we bring a "Bruce Lee approach" to business education—combining Eastern wisdom with world-class execution.







Our culture? Peaceful & Profitable. We believe in high performance without toxic hustle, building a remote team that wins together and celebrates together.







We're a tight-knit team of 9 scaling globally, and we need a strategic long-form video editor who understands that great content isn't just polished—it drives transformation.







The Opportunity







You'll be our Long-form Video Storyteller—the person who transforms raw footage into engaging educational experiences that teach, inspire, and spread our mission across YouTube, course platforms, and webinars.







This isn't a "churn and burn" editing gig. You'll produce 4-6 high-quality long-form videos per month (10-60+ minutes each) while collaborating directly with our Co-founders (Bryan Ang, CMO + Melvin Soh, Head of Creatives) and Content Manager to shape how we educate globally.







This role is for someone who:







Sees editing as storytelling architecture, not just technical execution



Obsesses over audio quality (because bad audio kills great content)



Can balance high volume (4-6 videos/month) with world-class quality



Wants to build something meaningful, not just collect a paycheck







What You'll Do







Video Production & Editing (Your Craft)







Edit 4-6 long-form videos monthly (10-60 min each) across YouTube, Amplifyyy (course platform), webinars, and podcast video



Process ~3 hours of raw footage monthly into polished, engaging educational content



Execute seamless cuts, transitions, b-roll, and motion graphics that enhance (not distract from) teaching



Ensure every frame reflects Market Leaders' brand—consistent, professional, globally excellent







Storytelling & Retention (Your Edge)







Structure long-form content for maximum retention (chapter breaks, pacing, hooks, payoffs)



Adapt Hormozi-style pacing (high-energy, retention-focused) to Market Leaders' voice



Create engaging openings that hook viewers in the first 30 seconds



Maintain narrative flow over 10-60 minutes (keep viewers watching, not clicking away)







Content Optimization (Your Systems)







Repurpose long-form content into clip libraries with timestamps for short-form team



Optimize videos for platform-specific best practices (YouTube retention, course clarity, webinar engagement)



Add captions, subtitles, and accessibility features (inclusive content wins)



Manage content library (organized raw footage, project files, exports—searchable and efficient)







Audio Excellence (Your Non-Negotiable)







Mix clean dialogue, balance music layers, and eliminate distracting noise



Ensure audio quality matches visual polish (no glitches, no volume jumps, professional sound design)



Apply EQ, compression, and sound design to keep listeners engaged







Creative Collaboration (Your Team Play)







Work closely with Content Manager on briefs, timelines, and feedback loops



Align with Melvin (Head of Creatives) on brand aesthetics and creative direction



Implement Bryan's strategic vision while contributing your editorial insights



Balance input from multiple stakeholders without ego or drama







Continuous Improvement (Your Growth)







Create video templates and presets (intros/outros, lower thirds, color grades) for efficiency



Document processes and workflows for scalability



Update and re-edit old content for repurposing



Stay current with long-form content trends and retention strategies







What You Bring







Must-Haves (Non-Negotiable)







Experience & Portfolio



2+ years editing long-form video (10-60+ min content—YouTube, courses, webinars, NOT just vlogs or entertainment)



Portfolio with links to your work (show us videos you've edited, ideally in education/coaching/business space)



Proven ability to produce 4-6 videos/month without sacrificing quality (show us you've handled consistent volume)



Experience with educational/coaching content (business education, thought leaders, course creation—not just lifestyle or entertainment)







Technical Skills







Mastery of video editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or CapCut Pro—quality matters more than the tool)







Audio mixing fundamentals (clean dialogue, music layering, noise reduction, EQ basics—audio quality is non-negotiable)







Color grading (consistent, professional look across all videos)







Pacing for retention (you know how to keep viewers engaged for 10-60+ minutes—chapter breaks, cuts, b-roll timing)







Basic motion graphics (text overlays, lower thirds, simple animations using built-in editing tools)







Strategic Mindset







Deep understanding of long-form storytelling (narrative arc, hooks, retention tactics, payoff structure)



Experience structuring educational content (modules, lessons, clear teaching flow—not just entertainment)



Asset management discipline (organized project files, version control, searchable libraries)



Familiarity with YouTube/webinar/course formats (platform-specific best practices)







Work Ethic & Execution







Deadline-driven (4-6 videos/month = consistent output, no missed deliveries)



Detail-obsessed (you catch the audio glitch at minute 47, the color shift at 22:30, the awkward cut at 8:15)



Self-directed but collaborative (works independently but communicates proactively with team)



Organized (file naming, backup systems, version control are second nature)







Cultural Alignment



Handles feedback without ego (multiple revision rounds = growth, not personal attacks)



Team-first mentality (collaboration over "artistic vision"—business results matter)



Proactive communicator (flags issues early, updates team without being asked—especially critical in async remote work)



Peaceful & Profitable mindset (focused 6-8 hour days, speaks up on unrealistic timelines, no burnout glorification)







Nice-to-Haves (Bonus Points)







Audio podcast editing experience (audio-only mixing, noise reduction, Audition/Logic Pro skills)



Thumbnail design skills (Canva/Photoshop basics—collaborate with graphic designer)



Moderate After Effects skills (2D animations, kinetic typography—takes motion graphics to the next level)



Template creation (Premiere Pro presets, project templates, efficiency systems)



Event/retreat videography editing (highlight reels, keynote recordings, multi-cam editing)



Course platform experience (Amplifyyy, Teachable, Kajabi—understands e-learning video requirements)



Content repurposing workflows (clip libraries, timestamp systems, multi-platform optimization)



Agency or high-volume environment experience (used to fast feedback cycles, tight deadlines)







Direct Access to Leadership



You'll collaborate regularly with our Co-founders (Bryan & Melvin) and Content Manager. Your ideas will be heard, tested, and implemented—not buried in corporate bureaucracy. You're joining a 7-person team where your work directly impacts our global mission.







Growth & Learning



Long-form content is evolving rapidly (AI tools, retention strategies, new formats). You'll be encouraged (and supported) to learn new techniques, test bold ideas, and evolve your craft continuously. Early tea
mbers help shape our creative direction.







Quarterly Team Retreats



We gather 3-4 times per year across Asia to connect, celebrate wins, and build culture in person. (Yes, we actually like each other. These aren't boring corporate offsites—they're genuine celebrations.)







Mission-Driven Work



You're not just editing videos—you're helping spread business wisdom that changes lives. Our content educates entrepreneurs globally, blending Asian philosophy with world-class strategy. Every video you craft helps someone build a better business.







Creative Freedom in a Structured Environment



We have high standards (Hormozi-level quality), but we trust our creatives. You'll get clear briefs and strategic direction, then have creative freedom to execute. We want your editorial insights, not robotic button-pushing.







Compensation & Stability



SGD $
/month (full-time, remote)



Stable monthly income (no more unpredictable freelance feast-or-famine)



Freelancers seeking a home base: this is it



Agency editors escaping burnout: this is your sanctuary





Apply Now!





Please submit your application here:

title: Short-Form Video Editor
description:
Hi! We’re Shoutout Digital, an Australia-based digital marketing agency that works with dental clinics and service businesses across the country.



This time, we’re on the lookout for a Short-Form Video Editor to help us create scroll-stopping social media videos. You’ll be working with a mix of raw video content, B-rolls, client-submitted footage, and other assets to produce short-form videos optimised for platforms like Instagram,
, and TikTok.



These aren’t heavy long-form edits, just fast, creative, punchy videos that get attention and get results.



What You’ll Be Doing



 • Create short, ad-ready videos

 • Use tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, or AI-assisted editors. Whatever gets the job done well

 • Edit videos for Meta, TikTok, Instagram. Mostly 15–30 sec videos

 • Add captions, transitions, animations, music, and hooks to make content engaging

 • Collaborate with our team for asset handovers and feedback



What We’re Looking For



 • Solid experience editing short-form videos for social media 

 • Eye for timing, pacing, and flow. You know when a video just feels right

 • Familiarity with platform trends (especially Meta & TikTok)

 • Comfortable working with raw B-roll and turning it into polished output

 • Able to receive feedback and iterate with ease

 • Good file management and timely handovers



Work Hours & Setup



 • This is a full-time role with a typical workload of around 30 to 40 hours per week. It may occasionally extend depending on what’s needed.

 • Work is only from Monday to Friday, so no weekend work is required.

 • You’ll have control over your schedule. We just ask that you’re mindful of our business hours (10 AM to 5 PM PHT) in case we need to touch base or align on anything.



Perks You’ll Enjoy



 • Paid leaves (yep, we want you to rest too)

 • Bi-weekly payouts, always on time

 • Performance bonuses when you do great work

 • All-expense paid team dinners and team buildings



How to Apply



We like to keep things simple. Just fill out this short form:







We’ll review your answers and reach out if shortlisted. Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Youtube Content Strategist
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for an experienced YouTube Content Creator & Growth Specialist who has successfully grown a YouTube channel before and understands how to turn content into real business results.

This role is not just about filming videos — it’s about strategic content creation, understanding the YouTube algorithm, and using long-form video to drive awareness, authority, and leads.

While experience in Amazon PPC / Amazon Ads or SaaS is a plus, we are primarily looking for someone who deeply understands YouTube growth mechanics and can apply them to a sales- or authority-driven business.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Content Strategy & Planning

- Develop and execute a YouTube content strategy aligned with business goals (growth, leads, authority)

- Research topics, keywords, and trends relevant to a sales-focused or B2B audience

- Build content calendars and plan for long-term channel growth



2. Content Creation

- Create engaging YouTube content (talking-head, tutorials, breakdowns, case studies, or similar)

- Craft strong hooks, titles, and video structures that maximize retention and watch time

- Collaborate on scripting or outlines when needed

- Ensure content is educational, actionable, and aligned with brand voice



3. Channel Growth & Optimization

- Optimize videos for YouTube SEO (titles, descriptions, thumbnails, tags)

- Analyze performance metrics (CTR, retention, watch time, subscribers)

- Continuously test and refine content formats, topics, and posting cadence

- Apply proven YouTube growth frameworks based on prior experience



4. Collaboration & Feedback

- Work closely with marketing, sales, or leadership teams to align content with offers

- Incorporate feedback while maintaining creative and strategic direction

- Repurpose long-form videos into short-form clips (optional but a plus)



Required Qualifications

- Proven experience growing a YouTube channel from scratch or significantly scaling an existing one

- Strong understanding of YouTube strategy, algorithm behavior, and best practices

- Experience creating YouTube content for business, education, or sales-driven audiences

- Ability to clearly explain complex topics in a simple, engaging way

- Comfortable on camera (or experienced directing on-camera talent)

- Strong storytelling, scripting, and content structuring skills

- Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze and improve performance



*Nice to Have*

- Experience creating content around Amazon PPC / Amazon Ads

- Background in SaaS, software, B2B services, or performance marketing

- Experience turning YouTube content into leads, demos, or sales

- Familiarity with content repurposing for Shorts, Reels, or TikTok



Roles Expectation : 

- Consistent YouTube channel growth (subscribers, views, watch time).

- High-retention, high-CTR videos that attract the right audience.

- Content that drives real business outcomes (leads, demos, authority).

- A clear, repeatable content system that scales over time.



To apply :



 us at *

1. Your Portfolio (must include Links to YouTube channels you’ve grown or managed & examples of videos created)

2. With
 subject line " Youtube Manager- YOUR NAME"

title: Airbnb property management assistant/Guest services
description:
Position: Airbnb Property management assistant to the director



Hours: Full-time, 40 hours per week (flexible hours)



Location: Remote / Online



Industry: Short-Term Rentals / Airbnb Management





We are seeking an experienced and highly organized  Assistant to support the Director in the day-to-day operations and optimization of a growing portfolio of premium short-term rental properties. This is a long-term, full-time remote role suited to someone with proven experience in Hostaway and multi-channel listing management.







You will play a key role in ensuring listings are optimised, guests are supported, and operational tasks are handled efficiently across multiple platforms.





Key Responsibilities





Channel & Listing Management



Assist with daily optimisation of listings across Airbnb, 
, VRBO, and Stayz, all operating within Hostaway

Monitor listing performance, pricing updates, availability, and content accuracy. Pricelabs integration active.

Ensure consistency of listing details, photos, amenities, and house rules across all platforms

Identify opportunities to improve occupancy, reviews, and overall guest experience



Guest Communication & Support

Respond to guest enquiries and messages promptly and professionally

Assist guests with booking questions, stay-related queries, and general support

Escalate complex issues to the Director when required

Maintain a warm, professional, and on-brand tone in all communications



Damage Claims & Review Management



Manage and lodge damage claims through Airbnb and other platforms where required

Assist with review disputes, evidence collection, and communication with platforms

Track and follow up claims to resolution

Maintain accurate records of i
 and outcomes



Welcome Packs & Guest Information

Create, update, and maintain digital guest welcome packs using Canva

Ensure all guest information is clear, current, and property-specific

Update house manuals, check-in instructions, local recommendations, and FAQs as needed



Administrative & Director Support

Provide general administrative support to the Director

Assist with operational tasks and ongoing process improvements

Support ad hoc projects related to property management and guest experience



Essential Requirements

description:
SEO Blog Writer Wanted (B2B / Industrial Focus)



We are a fast-growing digital marketing team based in China, working with **50+ international B2B manufacturers** across industrial sectors such as **valves, circuit breakers, packaging machinery, and electrical products**.



To support our long-term content strategy, we are looking for reliable freelance or part-time SEO blog writers to join our content team.



---



What We’re Looking For



**1. Strong English writing skills**

Native-level English or near-native proficiency, with clear structure, accurate grammar, and a professional B2B tone.



**2. Solid understanding of SEO content**

You should be familiar with writing **SEO-driven product category pages and blogs**, targeting keywords like *“industrial valve manufacturer”*, *“custom circuit breaker”*, and similar B2B search terms.



**3. Long-term, stable collaboration**

We prefer writers who can work with us consistently and deliver **at least one high-quality article (1,500–2,000 words) per week**.

title: Finance Associate
description:
Job Overview:



We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accountant/Bookkeeper to join our Finance team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, handling the invoicing process, and ensuring timely GST filings. This role requires a strong understanding of financial accounting principles, excellent organizational skills, and the ability to work independently.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Bookkeeping:

• Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software.

• Record day-to-day financial transactions, including purchases, expenses, sales, and receipts.

• Reconcile bank statements and ensure consistency in financial documentation.



2. Invoicing:

• Generate and process invoices accurately and promptly.

• Verify and record all financial transactions related to invoicing.

• Communicate with clients to address any invoicing inquiries and ensure timely payments.



3. Accounts Payable:

• Process vendor invoices and ensure timely and accurate payment according to terms

• Verify, code, and enter invoices into the accounting system.

• Maintain records of accounts payable transactions for monitoring



4. GST Filing:

• Work with our accounting vendors to prepare and submit timely GST returns.

• Stay informed about changes in GST regulations and ensure compliance.

• Resolve any GST-related issues and discrepancies.



5. Financial Accounting:

• Assist in the preparation of financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.

• Conduct regular financial analysis to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for improvement.

• Collaborate with the finance team to support budgeting and forecasting activities.



6. Documentation and Compliance with Singapore regulations:

• Maintain proper documentation for all financial transactions.

• Ensure compliance with accounting standards, policies, and procedures.

• Assist in internal and external audits as required.



Qualifications:



• Minimum 1 to 4 years of relevant experience

• Bachelor's degree in Accountancy

• CPA certification preferred

• Proven experience as an Accountant or Bookkeeper.

• Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices.

• Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero).

• Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

• Effective communication skills and the ability to work independently.

• Familiarity with GST regulations and filing processes.

• Familiarity with Singapore regulations will be viewed as a bonus



Additional Skills:



• Analytical mindset with problem-solving abilities.

• Time management skills to meet deadlines.

• Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Excel.

• Ability to adapt to changes in regulations and industry standards.



Attn: Kindly share the link to your resume when applying. Applications without a resume will not be considered. Thank you!

title: Amazon Private Label Product Researcher (Alibaba Sourcing – Market Analysis Specialist)
description:
I am looking for an experienced Amazon Product Research Specialist to help identify profitable products to source from Alibaba and launch as private label products on Amazon FBA.



This role is focused ONLY on product research and market analysis — not online arbitrage, listing creation, or account management.



Your responsibility will be to find product opportunities with strong demand, manageable competition, and healthy profit margins suitable for manufacturing and branding.



Responsibilities:

• Research and identify winning product opportunities for Amazon FBA

• Analyze demand using keyword research and sales data

• Evaluate competition (review count, seller saturation, listing quality)

• Estimate realistic landed cost (product cost + shipping + Amazon fees)

• Provide product research reports with data-backed reasoning

• Avoid restricted, branded, or highly saturated products

• Suggest differentiation opportunities where possible



Requirements:

• Experience with Amazon PRIVATE LABEL product research

• Strong knowledge of Keepa, Helium 10, Jungle Scout, or similar tools

• Understanding of Alibaba sourcing and manufacturing considerations

• Ability to calculate ROI, profit margins, and FBA fees accurately

• Experience analyzing keyword demand and market gaps

• Strong analytical thinking



IMPORTANT:

This position is NOT for online arbitrage or wholesale sourcing. Applicants must have experience researching products intended for manufacturing/private label.



To apply, please include:



1. A brief explanation of your product research process

2. Example of a product you researched and why it was a good opportunity

3. Tools you use for validation



Applications without this information will not be considered.

title: Happy Call Team(CS)
description:
About Haulla

Haulla, a smart waste collection service by Ecube Labs, operates in major U.S. markets including Dallas, Houston, Austin, Denver, and Chicago — with plans for further expansion across North America. We help small and mid-sized businesses across the U.S. find better, more affordable waste solutions.



What You'll Do

The Happy Call Team (CS) is responsible for ensuring customers have a positive experience with Haulla service by analyzing feedback, identifying improvements, and implementing effective solutions. Core responsibilities will include:



- Customer Satisfaction & Retention: Conduct proactive satisfaction checks ("Happy Calls") to verify customer satisfaction and identify potential friction points before they escalate into churn.

- AR & Collection Management: Proactively manage and collect outstanding AR (Accounts Receivable) to improve overall collection rates while minimizing customer attrition.

- Churn Mitigation & Recovery: Identify churn risks during the collection process and implement personalized recovery plans for long-term past-due accounts to encourage service re-entry and long-term loyalty.

- Billing Dispute Resolution: Serve as the primary point of contact for customer billing disputes and grievances, providing swift and effective resolutions that restore service confidence.

- Trust Rebuilding: Leverage positive collection experiences as an opportunity to rebuild trust and enhance the overall customer lifecycle value.



What We're Looking for

- This is a full-time remote position

- Available to work during U.S. business hours (7 AM–3 PM PST), Monday to Friday.

- Strong communication and problem-solving skills

- Native-level English fluency

- Familiarity in CRM tool (e.g., HubSpot) is a plus





Good To Have

- Experience in Collection Agency(Over 3+ years)

- Experience in Call Center

- Language Skills: Proficiency in Spanish is not required but is considered a significant advantage.



What You’ll Need (System Requirements)

- A desktop or laptop computer

- A quiet home workspace

- A noise-cancelling headset



Compensation



- Base salary plus performance-based bonuses

- Total earning potential: Php 60,000–130,000+/month

- Performance-based commission structure



Interested applicants may apply through the following Google form :

title: Podcast Guest Booking & Outreach Specialist
description:
Part-Time • Remote • Long-Term Potential

Hours: 10–20 per week to start

Experience Required: Proven podcast guest booking experience



About the Role

We are looking for a Podcast Guest Booking & Outreach Specialist to help secure high-quality podcast appearances for the owner of Big Hearted Breeders, Heather Gibson. 



This role is NOT about editing audio or managing social media.

Your sole focus is researching relevant podcasts, pitching hosts, and booking appearances.



You should already understand:

*What podcast hosts care about

*How to pitch without sounding generic or spammy

*How to track outreach and follow-ups consistently



About Us



Big Hearted Breeders Community is a mission-driven education and wellness brand rooted in the belief that pets can bring real hope, comfort, and healing into homes.



Founded by Heather Gibson—an experienced foster and adoptive parent, pet wellness educator, and advocate for ethical breeding—our work sits at the intersection of animals, mental health, education, and community. Through podcasts, educational programs, live and virtual events, and partnerships in the pet and wellness space, we help families, breeders, and pet lovers make informed, heart-centered decisions that support both human and animal well-being.



We are a values-driven team that cares deeply about:

*Kindness and integrity

*Thoughtful, ethical work

*Clear communication and reliability

*Long-term impact over short-term wins

*We believe in building sustainable systems, telling meaningful stories, and showing up with professionalism and heart. We’re looking for people who take pride in their work, enjoy collaboration, and want to contribute to something that genuinely helps others.



If you’re someone who values purpose, organization, and doing good work behind the scenes that creates real-world impact, you’ll likely feel at home here.



Primary Responsibilities

*Research and identify relevant podcasts aligned with our brand and audience

*Build and maintain a list of target podcasts and hosts

*Write and send personalized podcast pitch
s or DMs

*Follow up appropriately (without spamming)

*Track outreach, responses, and bookings in a simple system

*Coordinate booked appearances and confirm logistics

*Maintain a steady pipeline of upcoming podcast interviews





Required Experience & Skills (Non-Negotiable)

*Proven experience booking podcast guests (yourself or others)

*Strong research skills (finding the right shows, not just big ones)

*Excellent written English and persuasive communication

*Ability to personalize outreach at scale

*Organized tracking of pitches, follow-ups, and bookings

*Professional, respectful communication with hosts





Nice-to-Have (Not Required)

*Experience in wellness, pets, education, or mission-driven brands



What Success Looks Like

*Consistent outreach being sent weekly

*A growing list of booked podcast appearances

*Clear visibility into outreach and booking status

*Quality podcast placements that align with the brand



Compensation

*Hourly based on experience

*Competitive for proven results

*Performance-based increases possible as bookings grow





Who This Role Is Best For

-This role is ideal for someone who:

-Enjoys research and relationship-based outreach

-Understands podcast culture and host expectations

-Is persistent, organized, and detail-oriented

-Wants ongoing, flexible, part-time work with growth potential



How to Apply

Please include:

*A brief description of your podcast guest booking experience

*Examples of podcasts you’ve helped book guests on (if available)

*Your availability and preferred compensation structure

*Fill out the following. Applications without the form will NOT be considered: 



Applications without direct podcast booking experience will not be considered.

title: Front-End Web Developer (HTML/CSS)

Our website is primarily custom-built using HTML and CSS, with some pages and sections powered by a third-party page builder / embedded system. In addition to making edits and page updates, we need someone who can help keep the site visually modern, functionally competitive, and fast-loading.

title: Administrative Assistant (Remote – Philippines)
description:
Home Safety Ballarat: Who We Are

Home Safety Ballarat is a leading Victorian compliance and safety inspection company working closely with real estate agencies, landlords and property managers.



We specialise in:

* Gas Safety Checks

* Electrical Safety Inspections

* Smoke Alarm Compliance

* Rental Minimum Standards Assessments

* Rectification Works 

* Appliance Installs (Eg:Hot Water Systems, Split Systems etc)



We pride ourselves on professionalism, reliability and strong systems. As a growing family-run business, we value loyalty, attention to detail and team culture — and we extend that same respect and support to our remote staff.

We are looking for a highly organised, detail-oriented and reliable Administrative Assistant based in the Philippines to become an indispensable member of our administration team.



If you thrive on process, love structure, and want to be a valued long-term contributor, we would love to hear from you.





The Opportunity: Be Our Administrative Backbone



This isn’t just a data entry role — you will be the critical link that keeps our compliance operations running smoothly.



Working directly with our Australian-based administration team, you will take ownership of essential scheduling, compliance tracking and reporting tasks. You will play a key role in ensuring properties remain compliant and our real estate clients receive professional, timely service.



Key Responsibilities (What You’ll Be Doing)

Finance & Administration

Your role will focus on essential administrative and compliance-based tasks, including:

* Scheduling & Coordination of jobs

* Sending SMS and
 booking links to tenants

* Uploading compliance certificates to property managers

* Maintaining compliance tracking 

* Processing and receipting payments in Xero

* Assisting with overdue invoice follow-ups

* Maintaining accurate customer and property records



General Support

* Providing backup phone answering support during Australian business hours

* Responding professionally to real estate agents and tenants via



Required Skills & Experience (What You’ll Need)

Must-Haves



* Excellent written and verbal English

* Exceptional attention to detail (non-negotiable)

* Highly organised and process-driven

* Able to manage multiple systems independently

* Reliable home office setup with stable high-speed internet

* Professional, calm communication style



Highly Desirable

* Experience working remotely for an Australian company

* Experience in property management, trade services or compliance industries

* Familiarity with ServiceM8

* Experience using Xero



Why Join Home Safety Ballarat?

Be a Valued Tea
mber



You won’t be treated as “outsourced staff.” You will be an important and respected member of our team.



Long-Term Opportunity



We are seeking someone who wants stability and a long-term working relationship.



Supportive Environment



You will work closely with a friendly, Australian administration team who will provide support, systems and training.



Growth Opportunity

As our business continues to expand, there will be opportunities to grow with us.



How to Apply

Ready to become an integral member of the Home Safety Ballarat team?

Please submit:

Your updated CV/Resume

A cover letter detailing your experience with scheduling systems, compliance tracking and Xero (if applicable)



Confirmation that you have:

*A stable, reliable internet connection

* A quiet and professional home workspace

* Availability during Australian business hours

* We look forward to welcoming the right person into the Home Safety Ballarat team.

title: CRM & Automation Builder for Growing Life Insurance Agency — Long-Term, Full-Time
description:
About the Opportunity

We're a fast-growing life insurance agency looking for a sharp, technically-minded builder to join our team full-time and long-term. This isn't a gig — it's a career. You'll be working directly with the agency owner, Ashley, to transform how we run our business from the inside out using modern automation and CRM tools.

Here's the deal: we don't need you to be a senior developer. We don't need you to know everything. What we need is someone who is technical enough to learn fast, hungry enough to figure things out, and motivated enough to grow into a leadership role over time.



We will give you every tool you need to succeed. Your first three days will be a hands-on boot camp where we train you on our systems, our AI tools (including Claude Code and Claude Cowork), and our exact processes. You'll walk in with support and walk out ready to build.



What You'll Be Doing

Phase 1 — CRM Buildout (Immediate Priority)



Work inside GoHighLevel (GHL) to build out our own custom version of our CRM

Our current setup isn't cutting it — you'll help us redesign it from the ground up to fit how our team actually operates

Integrate our auto-dialer system directly into the CRM

Build custom features for our insurance agents so they can work faster and close more deals



Phase 2 — Recruiting Automation



Help automate our agent recruiting efforts from inside the same platform we use for sales

Build workflows that handle outreach, follow-up, and tracking so we're not doing everything manually



Phase 3 — Business Automation & Growth



Identify and implement other high-impact automations across the business

Streamline daily operations so the team can focus on selling and growing

As you prove yourself, you'll take on more responsibility and bigger projects





Who We're Looking For

Must-Haves:



At least some experience with GoHighLevel (you don't need to be an expert — just not starting from zero)

Some experience with automation tools (Zapier, n8n, Make, or similar) OR light development work

Strong communicator — you speak up, ask questions, and keep people in the loop

Full-time availability (40 hours/week)

Able to work at least half your hours on U.S. Eastern Standard Time

Self-motivated — you don't wait to be told what to do next



Nice-to-Haves:



Experience with any AI-powered development tools (Claude Code, Cursor, etc.)

API integration experience

Background in insurance, sales, or lead generation

Project management skills



The Right Mindset:



You're not just looking for a paycheck — you want to build something

You see this as an opportunity to grow into an executive-level role

You're comfortable being scrappy and figuring things out with the tools we give you

You want to be a partner in this business, not just an employee





What We Offer



$5–$10/hour USD depending on your experience and skill level

Full training — 3-day boot camp on our tools, systems, and AI platforms

All tools provided — Claude Code, Claude Cowork, and everything you need to do the job

Clear growth path — This role is designed to develop into our next Chief Operations Officer (COO)

Long-term stability — We're not looking for a freelancer. We're looking for a teammate.

Real mentorship — You'll work alongside people who will invest in your growth





The Interview Process

This is a two-step process:



Reply to this ad — Send an
 to 
 with the subject line "Life Insurance Opportunity"

You'll receive an automatic reply with your next steps, including:



A link to book your first interview with Justin

A short assessment (~10 minutes) that we need you to complete before your first interview





Interview 1 — A conversation with Justin to get to know you and review your assessment

Interview 2 — If we like what we see, you'll meet with Ashley, who will be your direct manager



The assessment isn't meant to trick you — it's meant to show us that you pay attention, follow instructions, and are genuinely engaged in the process. That matters more to us than a perfect resume.



Ready?

If you're technical, motivated, and excited about the chance to grow with a company that's building something real — we want to hear from you.

: 

Subject Line: Life Insurance Opportunity

We're looking forward to meeting the right person. Let's build together.

title: Elite Appointment Setters Wanted
description:
CLIENT SALES REP - FULL-TIME POSITION FOR HIGH PERFORMERS ONLY



WARNING: This isn't your typical "dial and smile" appointment setting role. We're building the #1 renovation growth agency in Australia, and we need absolute killers who thrive under pressure and deliver results. If you're looking for an easy paycheck, keep scrolling.



About ReynMedia



We're a renovator-specific growth agency helping high-ticket renovators ($20K-$100K+ AUD projects) generate consistent revenue. Our clients close $100K+ monthly because we don't mess around with cheap leads or empty promises.



We're scaling FAST: 10 clients now, 50 ASAP, 100 by end of 2026.



Your Mission As Client Sales Rep:



You're the bridge between high-value homeowners and life-changing renovation projects. Every call you make impacts thousands of families getting their dream homes.



Core responsibility: Call and qualify 100% of inbound leads to achieve 30-40% qualification rate.



What You'll Do Daily:



- Call new leads immediately when they come in (speed matters)

- Follow up with existing pipeline prospects

- Qualify homeowners for $20K+ renovation projects

- Track Leads Via GoHighLevel CRM

- Send Leads To Our Clients Directly Via Slack

- Communicate With Our Clients On Lead Specific Information

- Deliver an exceptional customer experience on every call

- Track performance and submit daily reports





Schedule & Compensation:



Hours: 9am-5pm Australian Eastern Daylight Time (full-time)

Base + Commission: $5/AUD + $6 commission for every lead you qualify

Uncapped earning potential - our killers make serious money ($600+ AUD per week)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- 1+ years phone-based B2C sales/appointment setting experience

- Proven ability to build rapport and trust quickly

- Experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred, training provided)

- Elite level organisation and consistency

- Sales-driven mindset with positive attitude

- Available during mandatory hours



BONUS: Prior experience with renovators/home services



Our Culture (Can You Handle It?):

- Pure devotion to delivering best-in-class service

- Extreme accountability - we call each other out

- Elite standards - we don't settle for second place

- Growth focused - personal and professional development

- Fun - a work environment our team loves working in every day



This role is an entry point to higher positions. We promote from within based on performance, commitment, and competency.



Don't Apply If...

- You can't handle direct feedback

- You're just looking for any paycheck

- You don't thrive in high-performance environments

- You can't commit to consistent daily activity



How To Apply:



1. Fill out application form: 
/
. MANDATORY: Record 60-second Vocaroo audio explaining why you'll crush this role

3. We respond within 24-48 hours if you advance to group interview



Applications without Vocaroo submissions videos are automatically rejected.



Spots fill fast when we post these positions. Apply immediately if you're serious about joining the ReynMedia team and helping renovators and homeowners achieve their dreams.

title: Customer Experience Agent (AI-Powered, Systems-Driven)
description:
Company: NordStick

Location: Remote

Type: Full-Time

Reports to: Founder / Head of Ops



About NordStick



NordStick builds premium performance fitness equipment for serious athletes and home gyms. Our products are engineered, our customers are passionate, and our standards are high.



Customer experience at NordStick is not a ticket-clearing function — it’s a brand touchpoint, revenue protector, and feedback engine.



We’re looking for an elite Customer Experience Agent who combines hospitality-level service, fitness familiarity, and AI + systems thinking to deliver an experience customers remember.



What This Role Is (and Is Not)



This role is not:



Copy-pasting canned replies



Treating CX as a cost center



Waiting for instructions on every ticket



This role is:



Using AI to move faster without losing empathy



Designing systems that reduce repeat issues



Treating every interaction like a hospitality experience



Protecting brand trust and revenue



Core Responsibilities

1. Deliver Hospitality-Level Customer Experience



Respond to customers across
, chat, and social channels with speed, clarity, and empathy



Handle high-impact issues (shipping delays, refunds, damage, chargebacks) calmly and professionally



Make customers feel heard, respected, and confident in NordStick



We value candidates who think like hospitality professionals:

anticipate needs, defuse frustration, and leave customers better than you found them.



2. Use AI as a Force Multiplier



Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gorgias AI, etc.) for:



First-draft responses



Ticket summarization



Pattern recognition (repeat issues, objections, confusion points)



Improve prompts, templates, and workflows continuously



Follow the principle: AI drafts ? humans d



3. Build & Improve CX Systems



Create and maintain:



Smart macros and templates



Triage rules (urgent vs non-urgent)



Clear escalation paths



Reduce ticket volume over time by fixing root causes



Improve FAQs, help docs, and workflows proactively



4. Protect Revenue & Retention



Prevent unnecessary refunds, returns, and chargebacks



Spot at-risk or high-intent customers early



Resolve issues before they escalate



5. Turn CX Into Insight



Track and share:



Top customer objections



Product confusion points



Shipping or ops failure patterns



Collaborate with Ops, Marketing, and Product to improve the business based on real customer data



What We’re Looking For

Must-Haves



2+ years in customer experience, support, or guest-facing roles



Strong written communication (clear, calm, human)



Comfortable using AI tools daily (not afraid of prompts, iteration, automation)



Systems mindset — you ask “Why does this keep happening?”



High ownership and accountability



Preferred Background (Very Important)



? Hospitality experience preferred

(hotels, restaurants, concierge, guest services, premium service environments)



Why this matters:



You understand tone, empathy, and de-escalation



You know how to handle frustrated customers gracefully



You don’t sound robotic under pressure



? Fitness experience is a plus

(coaching, gym work, training, personal fitness knowledge)



Why this helps:



You understand how customers use the product



You can speak confidently about training, setup, and expectations



You connect more naturally with our audience



Bonus Points



Shopify experience



Gorgias, Zendesk, Intercom, or similar tools



Experience reducing refunds or chargebacks



Built or improved CX workflows or automation

title: CONTENT RESEARCH EXPERT (CRE): $800 a month
description:
BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 7.5 hours/day

- Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible time

- Salary: $800 a month

- Paid every two weeks via Wise. (direct to your bank account, almost no fees, no waiting for payday!)

- Full work-from-home flexibility

- A young, supportive team that values your output without micromanagement

- Clear growth path with opportunities to expand your role

- Join our international team working with established content creators and brands

- Work with the latest AI tools and social media platforms



TASKS

- Research 30-50 viral short-form videos on Instagram Reels and TikTok

- Strategically select content ideas that will help specific clients go viral

- Organize all content ideas in the "Client Master Sheet"

- Copy/paste links to each content piece

- Write out the hook of each content piece

- Categorize content (Hero Story, Educational, Entertaining, Promotional)

- Add precise video instructions on how each piece can be replicated



TASK #2: Provide Strategic Content Direction



- Analyze client information (niche, target audience, personality, content style)

- Identify and recommend 3 inspirational accounts for clients to follow in their niche

- Create detailed instructions for content replication tailored to the client's abilities

- Think strategically about what will help each client succeed



TASK #3: Administrative Responsibilities



- Maintain a content library categorized by niche for efficient future use

- Complete daily End-of-Day Reports (EOD)

- Attend multiple meetings with your manager each week

- Continuously improve content recommendations based on what works



REQUIREMENTS



- Excellent English skills (C1 or above - non-negotiable!)

- Previous experience in content creation is a MUST

- Experience in content research and trend analysis

- Strong understanding of what makes content go viral

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts features

- Strategic thinking and attention to detail

- Ability to provide clear, actionable instructions

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

- 100% say-do ratio and commitment to deadlines



HOW TO APPLY



ROUND 1: Complete our application form and record a personal introduction:

/to/QRoz4WLV



Note: Put "CRE" + [Your Name & Family Name] in the "Name" field in the form.



Record a 3-minute Loom video introducing yourself (instructions in form)



Important: Please provide genuine, personal responses (no AI-written answers). We want to get to know YOU!



ROUND 2: Qualified candidates will be invited for an interview.



MORE ABOUT US



We've been in the industry since 2019 and have worked with over 3000 clients. We currently receive around 80-100 new clients per month. We provide an "80% done-for-you content & monetization system" that helps creators go viral and turn views into income using short-form content, AI, and proven strategies.

title: Part-Time Finance & Admin Assistant (QuickBooks Online – Brewery Industry)
description:
Hours: 7–10 hours per week to start (growth to 15 hrs/week)

Schedule: Flexible hours + 1 required weekly meeting during North American business hours

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Rate: $4–$7 USD/hour depending on experience

Company: Block Three Brewing Company Ltd. (Ontario, Canada)



About Us



We are a growing craft brewery in Ontario, Canada. We are building strong financial systems and looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Finance & Admin Assistant to support our weekly accounting and reporting.



You will work directly with the owner (CPA background) and help maintain accurate books and clean financial reporting.



This is a long-term role with room to grow from 7–10 hours/week to 15 hours/week.



Systems We Use



-QuickBooks Online

-Shopify

-Dext

-Clover

*Experience with QuickBooks Online is strongly preferred.



Responsibilities (Weekly Recurring Work)



Accounting & Reconciliation



-Bank and credit card reconciliations in QuickBooks Online

-Matching Shopify and Clover deposits to bank transactions

title: Remote Mortgage Funder
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

Job Title: Remote Mortgage Funder

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Experience Level: Entry-Level to Junior (1 year experience preferred)



Job Overview



We are seeking a Remote Mortgage Funder to join our dynamic team. While fresh graduates are welcome, at least 1 year of related mortgage funding or closing experience is preferred. This role is ideal for candidates who are eager to learn and grow within the U.S. mortgage industry and develop expertise in mortgage procedures, funding requirements, and regulatory compliance.



The Mortgage Funder will be responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate funding of mortgage loans while working closely with underwriters, loan officers, processors, and closing agents to support smooth and efficient loan transactions.



Key Responsibilities

> Loan Funding

> Review and verify loan documents to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with company policies and regulatory guidelines

> Prepare and execute funding wires and disbursement checks

> Coordinate with title companies and escrow agents to confirm all conditions are met prior to loan disbursement

> Ensure all required documentation is received, reviewed, and properly filed



Quality Control

> Conduct final audits of closed loan packages to ensure compliance with federal and state regulations

> Identify and resolve discrepancies or funding issues in a timely manner

> Maintain accurate and organized records of all funding transactions

> Communication and Collaboration

> Work closely with underwriters, loan officers, processors, and closing agents to facilitate efficient loan closings

> Provide professional and timely support to internal and external stakeholders

> Communicate funding delays, issues, or requirements clearly to all relevant parties



Compliance and Risk Management

> Stay current with industry regulations, investor guidelines, and company policies

> Participate in training and development programs to continuously improve knowledge and performance

> Assist with improving funding procedures and best practices as needed



Qualifications

> Education

> High school diploma or equivalent required

> Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, or a related field is preferred



Experience

> Fresh graduates are welcome

> At least 1 year of related mortgage experience (funder, closer, post-closing, or similar role) is preferred

> Familiarity with U.S. mortgage lending processes and documentation is a plus



Skills and Abilities

> Strong attention to detail and accuracy

> Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

> Clear written and verbal communication skills

> Ability to work independently in a remote environment

> Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook); experience with mortgage loan systems is a plus



Compensation and Benefits

> Competitive salary based on experience

> Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement

> Training and exposure to U.S. mortgage operations



How to Apply

> Interested candidates should submit their resume using a LINK and a brief cover letter outlining their qualifications and experience. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

title: Project Manager – Revenue Operations (EST Hours)
description:
Revenue Ops LLC is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Project Manager to oversee and support the successful execution of client and internal projects across our fast-paced consulting practice. This individual will be responsible for ensuring timelines are met, tasks are tracked and delegated effectively, customer support inquiries are addressed or routed appropriately, and stakeholders are aligned from start to finish. The ideal candidate has a strong command of English, is comfortable navigating complex projects in a dynamic environment, and can confidently lead cross-functional communication across marketing, sales, and operations technologies.



Key Responsibilities:

Lead project planning sessions and create detailed project plans with clear milestones, timelines, and deliverables.



Track the progress of multiple client and internal projects simultaneously using Mission Control in Salesforce.



Coordinate with consultants, developers, and client stakeholders to ensure clarity on tasks, status, and expectations.



Provide light customer support by responding to or triaging client questions, minor issues, and service-related requests in a timely and professional manner.



Proactively identify and manage risks, dependencies, and blockers to ensure successful delivery.



Facilitate regular project status meetings and maintain clear documentation of action items and next steps.



Communicate project updates clearly in written and verbal English to clients and internal stakeholders.



Support creation of project briefs, statements of work (SOWs), and other client-facing materials as needed.



Required Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in project management, ideally within a SaaS, RevOps, or consulting environment.



Strong written and spoken English; ability to lead client meetings and document outcomes with clarity.



Ability to work EST hours (9AM–5PM Eastern Time) consistently.



Experience managing projects in platforms like Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo, or similar RevOps tools is a plus.



Familiarity with agile and/or waterfall methodologies; PMP or similar certification is a plus but not required.



Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize in a fast-moving environment.



Customer-focused mindset with an ability to handle support communications professionally and effectively.



Preferred Traits:

Solutions-oriented mindset with a focus on progress over perfection.



Comfortable working independently and taking initiative while collaborating within a remote team.



Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.



Positive attitude and a strong commitment to delivering a high-quality client experience.



Looking for a part-time employee to start, with potential to ramp up to full-time.

title: Recruiting Operations Coordinator / Operations Specialist (Legal Recruiting)
description:
You are the process owner for day-to-day recruiting operations. Your job is to keep the candidate lifecycle moving forward with high accuracy (materials, submissions, follow-ups, scheduling, interview prep logistics, and offer tracking) while keeping Notion/records updated and communications professional.





- Maintain accurate candidate lifecycle records in Notion (statuses, tasks, touchpoints) and ensure every active process has a clear next action.

- Collect, organize, and QA candidate materials (resume, rep matters/deal sheet, writing sample, transcripts) in Drive/Notion; run follow-up cadence for missing items.

- Prepare and execute firm submissions 
/portal) with strict QA: correct firm, recipient, subject line, CC, attachments, filenames, and versions; log submission + create follow-ups.

- Run post-submission follow-ups on schedule; escalate stalled processes with context and recommended next steps.

- Coordinate interview scheduling across time zones; send availability requests, confirm times, and create error-free calendar invites with all logistics.

- Coordinate interview prep logistics (prep docs/materials distribution after approval) and provide day-of logistical support as needed.

- Track offers and deadlines (offer receipt, expiration reminders, status updates), and coordinate acceptance/decline communications and post-acceptance steps.

- Follow SOPs consistently, flag deviations early, and propose process improvements once stable in the role.

title: Global Virtual Assistant
description:

We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results oriented. · Organize and manage logistics for meetings, events, and conferences.

· Proficiency with calendar,
, and standard office software tools.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.

title: Warm Call Appointment Setter (NO COLD CALLING!) must be proficient in English!
description:
???? Warm Call Appointment Setter (NO Cold Calling – Warm Leads Only!)



If you love talking to people and you’re confident on the phone, this could be the perfect role for you.



We help U.S. veterans understand Medicare options that work alongside their VA or TRICARE benefits.



You won’t be selling.

You won’t be cold calling.

You’ll be helping veterans schedule a free educational consultation.



What This Role Looks Like



You’ll be:



Calling veterans who already requested information



Using a simple script



Keeping conversations friendly and engaging



Booking appointments with licensed specialists



Working remotely



If you sound robotic, this won’t work.

If you sound confident and warm — you’ll thrive here.



Ideal Candidate



Strong English speaker



Clear, confident tone



Not afraid of objections



Can follow a script but still sound human



Reliable and detail-oriented



Comfortable using CRM systems



Bonus if you’ve worked in:



Appointment setting



Insurance



U.S.-based campaigns



Veteran-related campaigns



???? HOW TO APPLY (MANDATORY STEPS)



We only review applicants who follow instructions.



1. Record a Loom video:



Include:



Introduction (Who you are, experience)



Why you are the right fit



One fun personal fact



Read the script below naturally



2.
 the Loom link to:



???? 



3. Use This Subject Line:



Appointment Setter Application – [Your Name]



All materials must be in ONE
.



Sample Script (Read This in Your Loom Video)



Hi John, this is [Your Name] calling on behalf of a veteran-focused nonprofit. How are you today?



Great! The reason for my call is to let you know about a valuable Medicare review available to veterans like yourself. Many veterans don’t realize there are Medicare plans that can work alongside your TRICARE for Life or VA benefits, possibly adding extra coverage and savings. We’re offering a free, no-obligation consultation with a specialist who can walk you through your options. It’s a quick call, and many veterans have found it extremely helpful. Would you be open to scheduling a time to learn more?



Great! I just need a few quick details to get you scheduled. What day and time works best for you?

title: Warm Lead Caller
description:
IF YOU ARE NOT FLUENT IN ENGLISH DO NO APPLY



The Harbert Real Estate Group, a trailblazer in the real estate sector, is actively searching for an articulate, charismatic, and highly skilled English Cold Caller. As we ambitiously scale our operations, we seek an individual who can confidently initiate conversations, spark interest, and drive results through effective communication over the phone.



Job Type: Full-Time (35-50 hours per week)

Work Hours: 8:30am-6:00pm CST

Location: Remote (US working hours required)



Do you have an innate ability to strike up conversations, identify needs, and communicate value propositions with precision and flair? If you're adept at navigating the nuances of the English language with ease and poise, then this opportunity could be tailor-made for you.



Key Responsibilities:

• Engage with potential clients over the phone, introducing them to our offerings and highlighting the value we bring.

• Diligently handle objections and answer questions to ensure clear communication.

• Maintain accurate records of calls and outcomes in our CRM.

• Consistently strive to meet and exceed predetermined targets.

• Continuously refine your approach based on feedback and performance data.

• Attend regular training sessions to enhance product knowledge and communication tactics.



Qualifications:

• Fluent in spoken English with a clear, engaging, and persuasive tone.

• Previous experience in a cold-calling or telesales role is advantageous.

• Strong listening and problem-solving skills.

• Resilient attitude with an ability to handle rejection and persist with a positive demeanor.

• Familiarity with CRM tools and telecommunication software.

• Willingness to undertake further training and coaching sessions.



Benefits:

We offer a competitive salary package, in-depth training, and a positive, results-driven work culture. As a valued member of our team, you'll have the chance to refine your skills, grow your career, and be part of a vibrant community.



If you're someone who thrives in building connections and crafting compelling narratives over the phone, we'd be thrilled to welcome you aboard. To apply, send your resume and a brief cover letter emphasizing your relevant experience and reasons for pursuing this role to 
 with the subject line "Warm Caller – 150".



Additionally, as a part of the screening process, please provide:



1. DISC Assessment (if you don’t have one, you can get one for free at 
/disc)

2. Internet Speed screenshot - 
/

3. Typing Test - 
/

4. A 2-3 minute audio recording introducing yourself and explaining why you would be an excellent fit for this position.

We eagerly await your application, hopeful for the next voice of our team!
