title: Customer Service - ECommerce
description:
Job Description:

As an Amazon Customer Service Representative, you will be responsible for providing top-notch customer service to our Amazon customers. You will handle inquiries, resolve issues, and ensure customer satisfaction. This role requires a detail-oriented individual with excellent communication skills and a strong understanding of Amazon's platform.



Note: Please send a link to your updated CV with appropriate sharing access, failure to comply will not move forward with the application.



Key Responsibilities:

Respond to customer inquiries and provide assistance through Amazon's messaging system,
, and phone.

Resolve customer issues, including order problems, product inquiries, and return requests.

Monitor and manage customer reviews and feedback on Amazon.

Ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment and shipping.

Collaborate with the warehouse and fulfillment team to address any order-related issues.

Maintain a high level of product knowledge to assist customers effectively.

Track and report on customer service metrics and identify areas for improvement.

Stay up-to-date with Amazon policies and procedures to ensure compliance.

Assist in the development and implementation of customer service policies and procedures.



Qualifications:



Previous experience in customer service, preferably in an e-commerce or Amazon-focused role.

Strong understanding of Amazon's platform, including Seller Central and ecommerce

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Excellent soft skills with C2 rating

Ability to handle high-volume customer inquiries and remain calm under pressure.

Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills.

Proficient in using customer service software and tools.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

High school diploma or equivalent; a bachelor's degree is a plus.

title: AI Image Generator (200 Images)
description: Looking for someone to generate images from a script for a YouTube project. This is a repetitive but simple task — no artistic skill needed. You will follow a clear SOP and select the best AI-generated image for each script line.

title: DM Setter + Follow-Up Specialist
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Instagram DM Setter to handle inbound conversations, qualify leads, and move them toward booking and enrolling into our online fitness coaching program. This is a long-term role (30–40 hrs/week) with core working hours 5pm–10pm Spain time plus daytime flexibility to keep response times fast. You’ll be working inside our systems (CRM + KPI sheets), following our conversation framework, and earning base salary + commission on sales.



Responsibilities:

- Reply to inbound Instagram DMs quickly and professionally (fast turnaround matters)

- Build rapport, ask the right questions, and qualify leads using our scripts/framework

- Drive leads toward the next step (book calls / collect details / move to enrollment)

- Follow up consistently to reduce drop-offs and no-shows

- Log conversations, stages, and outcomes in our CRM

- Update daily/weekly KPI sheets (response time, convos started, booked calls, show-ups, sales attributed)

- Maintain a high standard of written English and brand tone in every conversation

- Take feedback/coaching, improve messaging, and hit weekly targets consistently

title: Customer Success Coach / Psychologist
description:
Juliana Joy Coaching is an online B2C business established to help women have happy and steady relationships and feel happier with their life.



We provide digital self-study courses, online programs and coaching services with a holistic approach for quick, energetic alignment. 



Our tiny and mighty team is on a mission to create a world full of happy, emotionally safe relationships for both partners, the man and the woman.



The experience and knowledge our clients gain through working with us will support them for a lifetime and beyond.



Meet the founder: 





Who We Serve:



Spiritual women on their path of self-development looking to improve their relationship

Divorced moms who want to have again (or finally) a fulfilling relationship

Single women who want to enjoy life and pursue their passions and career

Women with high level of awareness who studied psychology and understand they have an anxious attachment style or an anxious-avoidant attachment style.





Key Responsibilities:



In a nutshell, you will be in charge of all clients, from self-study minicourses to 3-6 month high-ticket programs, focusing on building relationships, identifying opportunities for upselling and cross-selling, and ensuring client retention.

Your job combines three main pillars:

Ensuring professional and smooth account management, including onboarding, organization, and support during program duration, retention, and offboarding 

Upselling and retention.

Mindset and accountability coaching, identifying objections, and helping the clients overcome them. Delivered inside the community as a Q/A thread and on regular 1-1 calls with clients. You’ll be trained in the Bring Him Closer Energetic Method.



Other Responsibilities:



You may be engaged in other tasks related to social media and content creation, such as listening to videos/audios and correcting transcripts, video editing / creation with Descript, and potentially creating social media posts with Canva. 





In more detail, you will be doing the following:



Communicate with clients to set healthy expectations and handle any questions, objections, or complaints via
, text or phone/zoom.

Build rapport to become the trusted go-to person for any questions (except coaching questions, of course)

Coaching clients inside the community on mindset and successfully applying the Bring Him Closer Method

Upsell and cross-sell into other programs or follow-up offers

Coordinate signing agreements and answer questions if needed

Help clients with community and learning portal access & provide how-to training when necessary via
 or Zoom

Monitor and ensure engagement during the program/course duration and support clients with resistance, if any. That also includes coordination of groups and 1-1 calls.

Payment monitoring and payment collection negotiations

Processing of refunds

Collecting feedback about the courses

Coordinating client testimonial interviews





Requirements:



We know that superstars are not born but made, and we will provide profound training to help you develop into the role. The following requirements are, however, a must:



Studies in psychology or coaching certification with experience

Sales experience: You have a minimum of 6 months of experience in sales, preferably in account management or after-sales, where you could offer and successfully sell additional products or services to existing clients.

Relationship-building personality: You feel joy when you communicate well with your clients. You are happy to help and offer them something you know will help them.

Highly organized: You enjoy having a to-do list and structuring your work day to achieve more quickly.

Proactive: Waiting and being too patient is not for you. You enjoy seeing results and feel good about making the first and subsequent moves to get results. 

Emotional intelligence and empathy: You enjoy talking to women about their emotions and relationships. You can build relationships and trust quickly and put yourself in their shoes.

Independent: You feel comfortable working from home with minimal supervision.

Access to High-Speed Internet + Laptop + Quiet Environment + professional Zoom Background

1+ years experience working with Europe or US-based businesses





Nice to have:



This experience is not crucial, but we know it will help you: 

Appointment setting, customer service, cold calling, cold outreach, CRM work, coaching training i.e. NLP, an academic degree in psychology or communication





Time and Renumeration:



This freelance position requires 35-40 hours per week. During launch times, you may have a week with more hours as a group of clients will need an onboard at once followed by a few weeks with less workload. 





You will have an extensive 3-6 month onboarding and training on the job (paid, of course).



Application:



Please send your CV and relevant information about your previous qualifications.

In addition to that, please record a short video (max 2 min.) answering the questions below. Applications without video will not be reviewed.



What element of this job opportunity makes you feel most excited about?

If you were given the task to generate an additional $1,000 of sales for Juliana Joy Coaching in the role of Success Coach, what specific strategies or ideas would you implement to achieve this? Please explain your thought process?

What is essential for building a connection with a new client so they start trusting you?            

Imagine you are having an onboarding call with a new client. What questions would you ask them to help them set goals and expectations from the program?

Can you describe a time when you had to coach someone through a challenging emotional situation? How did you approach it?

How do you stay organised when managing multiple clients and tasks? Can you give an example of how you managed your time during a particularly busy period?

How do you stay productive and motivated while working independently from home?

What tools have you used for managing client communication, social media content creation, or video editing? Please provide specific examples.

How comfortable are you with handling multiple types of tasks, such as responding to client inquiries, editing videos, and creating social media posts?

Rate your willingness to learn on a scale of 1 to 10?

Rate your flexibility towards taking on various tasks on the scale of 1 to 10

title: YouTube Marketing Copywriter (15th & 30th Pay + Bonuses)
description:
*Will be making a decision within 24 hours.*

**If you have YouTube Experience doing titles, SEO, and Lead Magnets, please state that in your application.**



We are two Filipino Entrepreneurs looking for someone to help with YouTube Marketing for our YouTube Media Marketing Company (Real Estate Niche). We have ONE SPOT that just recently opened up and are trying to fill it FAST.



The culture that we've built within our team is like a family. We are all Filipino and can understand Tagalog and Bisaya, but we prefer English. We take yearly team trips. Here are some photos from one of our team trips to La Union last year - 





We work with top talent and handle over 30+ real estate clients in the United States.



REQUIREMENTS

You must be Advanced/Proficient in English, both writing and speaking

You must be coachable and have a willingness to learn

We will prioritize your application if you have experience in copywriting, creating titles, SEO, and Lead Magnets..

Digital Marketing experience is also a plus.



Pay:

We pay every week through Payoneer. On top of the base weekly pay, we offer a quarterly bonus. If your KPIs are good, you can win prizes at the end of the year. 



We're looking for somebody who is teachable and can work very fast, so if you are a quick learner and can perform the tasks that we ask, you will be compensated very well. What are you waiting for? APPLY NOW because interviews get booked, and we hire FAST (Usually within 2-4 days). There is HUGE upside potential. Again, the salary stated in the application is only STARTING SALARY. You have the potential to make as much as you want if you can provide great value.

title: Video Editor & Social Media Assistant
description:
About the Role



I’m looking for a creative, visually-minded Video Editor & Social Media Assistant to help build my personal brand online while also supporting content creation for my marketing clients.



This role is ideal for someone who understands visual branding, short-form storytelling, and how to turn raw footage into polished, engaging content. You should be confident taking creative direction, but also proactive in suggesting content ideas and visual approaches. Strategy will primarily come fro
, your role is to bring it to life creatively and consistently.



Key Responsibilities

- Edit short-form videos for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and LinkedIn

- Create engaging edits with motion graphics, captions, and light animations

- Repurpose long-form content into bite-sized, high-impact clips (time stamps will be provided from long-form)

- Design clean, on-brand social graphics (covers, carousels, story posts)

- Help maintain a consistent visual identity across all platforms

- Pitch visual/content ideas that improve engagement and storytelling



Requirements

- Proficiency in After Effects (required)

- Elite color-grading

- Strong video editing skills with an eye for pacing, hooks, captions, and transitions

- Solid understanding of visual branding and modern design aesthetics

- Ability to follow creative direction while contributing ideas

- Excellent written English (for captions and light copy support)

- Organized, reliable, and deadline-driven

- Active portfolio showcasing video edits, motion work, and social content



Nice to Have

* Familiarity with content planning or scheduling tools



How to Apply

Please send:

- Your portfolio (required)

- Links to social media accounts you’ve edited or managed

- Your availability and rates

title: Executive Assistant for Finance and Operations - Remote
description:
Why this role?

If you’re a detail-driven finance pro who enjoys keeping numbers, people, and processes in sync, you’ll love this hybrid seat. You’ll own day-to-day finance, keep ops humming, and lend a light hand to admin responsibilities — while working from home.



What you’ll do:

* Finance

·  Bookkeeping, invoicing, payroll, and account reconciliations in QuickBooks

·  AP/AR reporting, cash-flow updates, support for tax filings, and insurance renewals

·  Maintain finance dashboards and ensure accurate month-end reporting



* Administrative Operations

·  Manage company
, phone support (5–10 calls/day), calendars, and scheduling for clients/vendors/team

·  Build and maintain SOPs and process docs

·  Track agreements and contracts (review, routing, signatures)

·  Support hiring: post jobs, screen applicants, coordinate onboarding/offboarding

·  Keep HubSpot CRM clean and current (clients, leads, activities)

·  Help with social posts, simple content updates, and Google Business Profile

·  Research industry trends for content and team presentations



What you’ll bring

·  1+ year in admin + phone support (inbound/outbound, 5–10 calls/day)

·  Excellent English, clear and friendly phone presence for US clients

·  Proficient with QuickBooks, Microsoft Office, and Google Workspace

·  Working knowledge of HubSpot CRM and basic social scheduling tools

·  Confident with online calendars (Google/Outlook/Calendly)

·  Process-minded: you enjoy creating/streamlining SOPs

·  Highly organized, detail-obsessed, self-motivated, and resourceful



Tech requirements (non-negotiable). Attach device specs/screenshots with your application.

·  Laptop/desktop (? 3 years old)

·  CPU: Intel i5 10th-gen+ / AMD Ryzen 5+

·  RAM: 8GB+

·  Internet: 50–100 Mbps (with backup)

·  A/V: Working webcam, mic, and headset



Benefits & Perks

·  Base pay $5/hour (? $800/month) + benefits

·  Paid Company Holidays, PTO, Referral incentives

·  HMO upon 1st year

·  Quarterly PAG-IBIG incentive

·  Tech incentive

·  Tokens from employee engagement events

·  Company-facilitated hackathons / free learning sessions

·  Year-end virtual event

·  Bi-monthly salary

·  Weekends off

·  Supportive remote team community



How to apply (3 quick steps):

1.
 

Subject: Job Application — Executive Admin (Finance & Ops)



2. Attach your resume and device specs/screenshots.



3. In the body, answer briefly (2–3 sentences each):

- Your experience with QuickBooks (modules used + typical weekly tasks)

- A recent finance/ops process you improved—what changed?

- Your internet speed (main + backup), and your working hours preference



Tip: Links to a portfolio, sample reports/dashboards, or SOP you created are a plus.

title: Business Development Representative (BDR) – Sales & Outreach for Ad Network
description:
We are looking for a high-energy, proactive Business Development Representative (BDR) to help us expand our digital out-of-home advertising network. Your primary goal is to contact bar and venue owners to secure agreements for installing our advertisement-display TVs at zero cost to them.



Your Responsibilities:

- Multi-Channel Outreach: Cold calling,
ing, and messaging bar owners/managers via Instagram and
.

- Lead Management: Tracking all conversations and follow-ups in our CRM - a Google Sheet

- Pitching: Explaining the value proposition ($2,000 to $3,000 per year in passive income and free promotional slots).

 - Appointment Setting/Closing: Getting the owner to agree to a TV installation.



Requirements:

- Excellent verbal and written English (must be comfortable on the phone).

- Experience in lead generation or cold outreach.

- Ability to handle "no" and stay motivated.

- Tech-savvy (Instagram,
, CRM).



Bonus:

- For every landed client, you will receive a $50 bonus.

title: YouTube Monetization & Growth Expert – Kids & Faith-Based Channels
description:
ABOUT US

We manage two growing YouTube brands:

- Pawws Lyfe – a children's entertainment universe led by Raww Raww, a fun basketball-loving French Bulldog and dog basketball teams like the Los Angeles Lickers. Content is family-friendly, positive, and focused on teamwork, confidence, friendship, and kindness.

Under the surface- A Christian / faith-based channel focused on encouragement, teaching, and practical Bible-based content.



We are looking for a data-driven YouTube expert who can turn both channels into consistent, predictable revenue streams while staying aligned with our brand values.



RESPONSIBILITIES

- Audit both channels (Pawws Lyfe + religious channel) and create a clear monetization roadmap (30/60/90 days).

- Optimize every video for growth and revenue: titles, descriptions, tags, thumbnails, end screens, cards, playlists, and monetization settings.

- Grow to and beyond YouTube Partner Program requirements and maintain policy compliance.

- Develop and manage weekly upload and content calendars for both channels.

- Conduct keyword and competitor research to find profitable topics for kids content and Christian content.

- Analyze YouTube Studio analytics (CTR, AVD, RPM, CPM, retention) and provide weekly reports with clear actions.

- Test and improve thumbnails, titles, and formats using A/B style testing and data.

- Identify and implement additional monetization opportunities: Shorts, live streams, memberships, Super Chat, merch, and off-YouTube offers when relevant.

- Ensure all content follows YouTube policies, especially for kids content and faith-based topics.

- Suggest collaborations, cross-promotions, and growth tactics that fit our brand.



REQUIREMENTS

- Proven experience growing and monetizing YouTube channels (send links + before/after results).

- Strong understanding of YouTube SEO, algorithm, and monetization features.

- Comfortable working with children's / family content and Christian / faith-based content.

- Experience using tools like TubeBuddy, VidIQ, or similar is a plus.

- Able to create simple thumbnail briefs or guide a designer.

- Excellent English communication and ability to document processes and results clearly.

- Reliable, proactive, and comfortable working with clear KPIs and weekly reporting.



OFFER & WORK SETUP

- Long-term role if performance is strong.

- 100% remote, flexible hours (must meet deadlines).

- Base pay (monthly) plus performance bonuses tied to growth and monetization milestones.



HOW TO APPLY

Please send:

title: Content Manager / Social Media Manager (Creator-Led Lifestyle Brand)
description:
Hiring: Content Manager / Social Media Manager

(Creator-Led)

Focus: Motherhood · Surf · Coastal Living · Joyful Family Lifestyle

About the Brand

This brand is rooted in having fun, living in alignment, staying positive, and prioritizing real-life experiences. The

content is intentionally designed to work both during travel and during everyday home life. Not all growth 
nts

happen on trips — everyday coastal living, motherhood, and family life are just as important.

What This Role Is

This is a creator-led content role. I create the photos and videos, and my husband (a videographer) helps film content.

Your role is to take what we already capture and turn it into consistent, ready-to-post content — and to help us plan

simple content ideas that work whether we’re traveling or at home.

Responsibilities

• Turn existing photos and videos into finished posts (reels, carousels, stories)

• Write captions that reflect a fun, aligned, positive tone

• Repurpose content so one filming session supports multiple posts

• Schedule posts and keep content organized

• Suggest realistic post and reel ideas my husband can film — including home-based, everyday lifestyle content when

we are not traveling

• Provide light filming prompts or shot ideas (
nts to capture, angles, simple concepts — no heavy scripting)

What This Role Is Not

This is not a viral-trend role, not a high-pressure growth role, and not a basic virtual assistant position. We are building

a sustainable brand, not chasing constant travel or hype.

Who This Is For

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys organizing content, repurposing ideas, and helping a creator stay

consistent. You understand lifestyle and motherhood brands and appreciate that everyday life content can be just as Powerful as travel content

title: NSA IDR Award Collections Specialist (Insurance Follow-Up & Medical Billing)
description:
An experienced insurance follow-up / medical billing professional who can confidently call U.S. insurance carriers/TPAs, navigate their systems, and consistently get unpaid No Surprises Act (NSA) IDR awards paid.



ob description* (paste this whole block)



We are hiring an NSA / No Surprises Act IDR Award Collections Specialist to collect unpaid Federal IDR awards by calling insurance carriers/TPAs and driving payment through to completion.



This is a phone-heavy role. You must speak fluent, professional English and be confident making outbound calls to U.S. insurance companies to get these claims/awards paid.



Core Responsibilities



Make high-volume outbound calls to insurance carriers/TPAs to collect unpaid NSA IDR awards and secure firm payment timelines.



Navigate payer departments effectively (claims, appeals/grievances, provider services/relations, escalations) and push files forward until paid.



Provide clear, professional English communication on every call; obtain reference numbers, call notes, supervisor names, and confirmed next steps.



Track each award from “award issued” ? “payment received,” including call logs, follow-up cadence, and documentation status.



Submit and follow up on required documentation (IDR award letter, dispute identifiers, claim details, payee/tax ID confirmation, etc.).



Identify and resolve common non-payment issues (no record found, misrouting, missing attachment, incorrect payee, EOB/ERA mismatch, reprocessing needed, system notes not updated).



Escalate appropriately when overdue (supervisor escalation, provider rep, written follow-up per our workflow) and keep management updated.



Required Experience



Strong U.S. medical billing / insurance collections / claims follow-up experience.



Fluent English (spoken and written) with a confident, professional phone presence.



Proven ability to call payers and get results (not just “status checks”).



Highly organized: able to manage many files, keep clean notes, and follow a process.



Familiarity with No Surprises Act / Federal IDR is required.



Success Metrics



Faster payment timelines and fewer stuck files.



Higher conversion rate of unpaid awards to paid.



Clean, audit-ready tracking and reliable weekly updates.



To apply, please include:



Your medical billing/collections background



NSA/IDR experience



A video of yourself speaking English and explaining the NSA IDR Process.



Which payers you’ve worked with most

Bookkeeping & cleanup



Financial clarity for business owners

Balance Sheet



Cash Flow

Success Looks Like This

Books are accurate, clean, and tax-ready



Less than 1% corrections after CPA review



You proactively identify and solve issues



This Role Is NOT For You If:

You’ve never handled cleanup work



You struggle with deadlines or communication



You are not confident in U.S. bookkeeping standards



? This Role IS For You If:



You have real experience cleaning up messy books

You take ownership and solve problems independently



You are detail-oriented and communicate clearly



You want to grow your skillset and take on more responsibility over time



Requirements

Understanding of:



Reconciliations



Journal entries



Month-end close



Strong written and spoken English



Reliable internet + time tracking (Clockify)



Bonus (Not Required)



Experience with TaxDome or Go High Level



Experience working with tax teams



Accounting or finance background



Why Join Harvest AF



Long-term, stable role (we are growing quickly)



13th-month pay + performance bonuses



Opportunity to increase hours and responsibility based on performance



Faith-driven, purpose-centered culture



You’ll help build real systems — not just complete tasks



Work directly with a CPA-led team focused on accuracy and growth



How to Apply

Bookkeeper Application – [Your Name]



Include:

Tools you’ve used (QuickBooks, etc.)



Example of a cleanup project:



What was wrong



What you fixed



Final result



Your current schedule (Philippine Time)



IMPORTANT (Read Carefully)



At the top of your application, answer this:



What is the first thing you check when starting a bookkeeping cleanup and why?

Application Review

Interview

title: AI-DRIVEN ORGANIC CONTENT CREATOR (SMM)
description:
Company: Beauty Sleep Club



Role Type: Full-Time Contractor (Remote)



Objective: Scale organic reach to 1M+ monthly views and drive profitable acquisition through high-volume, AI-enhanced short-form video.



THE CORE MISSION



You are a Creator First. You will architect a viral presence by combining raw creative intuition with a cutting-edge AI stack. Your goal is to dominate the "Beauty Sleep Ritual" conversation by producing a massive volume of luxury-minimalist content that converts.



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)



Reach: Achieve and maintain 1,000,000+ views per month across TikTok and Instagram Reels.

Growth: Drive net positive follower growth of 500–2,000+ per month.

Volume: Maintain a strict daily output of 10 high-quality assets.

Sales: Generate consistent, trackable link clicks to our BOGO offer pages.



DAILY CONTENT TARGETS (70 PIECES PER WEEK)

To succeed in this role, you must utilize AI to hit the following daily output:



5x Reels / TikToks: High-reach viral hooks, educational sleep tips, and "Ritual" unboxings.

3x Carousels: Educational deep-dives and aesthetic mood boards designed for "Saves".

2x Image Posts: High-end, luxury-minimalist statics generated/enhanced via Higgsfield.



RESPONSIBILITIES



AI-Native Workflow: Use Higgsfield for premium static ads and motion assets.

Trend Hijacking: Use AI social listening to identify viral trends and "remix" them for Beauty Sleep Club within a 4-hour window.

Platform Mastery: Manage the full end-to-end process of scripting, filming, and AI-editing.

Scheduling: Use Metricool to schedule all 10 daily posts for peak engagement times in the US and AU markets.

Reporting: Track and report weekly on reach, engagement, and link-click conversion metrics.



REQUIRED SKILLS & TOOLS



The AI Stack: Mastery of Higgsfield, ChatGPT/Claude, and AI video editing (CapCut, Captions.ai, or similar).

The Social Stack: Expert-level knowledge of Metricool and Instagram/TikTok algorithms.

Creator Intuition: You know exactly why a video goes viral and how to replicate it.

Aesthetic Alignment: Ability to execute a Luxury Minimalist brand voice that justifies our premium price points.





HOW TO APPLY



Please submit your portfolio and a brief 60-second video explaining how you would use AI to scale Beauty Sleep Club to 1M views this month.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
The Role

Core Studios is a premium real estate content production company with nine specialist departments, serving leading agencies and developers across Australia. We’re scaling fast and need an exceptional EA to become the operational backbone of our leadership team.

You’ll primarily support the General Manager while providing structured support to Directors across the business. This isn’t a task-taker role — you’re a strategic support partner who protects executive time, drives accountability, and ensures nothing falls through the cracks.

The principle is simple: the GM should only do what only the GM can do. Everything else is your domain.



What You’ll Own

•	Calendar & Time Management — Full ownership of the GM’s schedule. Prioritise by strategic value, prepare briefings, protect focus time, and coordinate across the leadership team.

•
 & Communications — Triage the GM’s inbox, draft responses in their voice (confident, warm, direct), chase follow-ups, and manage cross-departmental communication via
 and Slack.

•	Accountability & Follow-Through — Maintain a live priority tracker, ensure department leads deliver on commitments, prepare weekly reports, and escalate blockers before they become problems. This is the most critical function of the role.

•	Meeting & Leadership Support — Prepare agendas and pre-reads, capture minutes and action items, track accountability, and ensure Directors have what they need ahead of key meetings.

•	Financial & Reporting Support — Revenue summaries, targets vs actuals, invoice follow-up, department dashboards, and budget tracking across Xero and Google Sheets.

•	CRM & Systems — Keep CRM data clean, manage job management platforms, maintain SOPs, and support system migrations and process documentation.

•	Sales & Client Support — Draft proposals and pitch decks, track pipeline activity, prepare client-facing collateral, and research new business opportunities.

•	Operations & Production — Coordinate suppliers, track SLAs, follow up on production deadlines, and manage vendor databases.

•	Marketing & Content — Schedule social content, draft LinkedIn posts for the GM, repurpose internal content into external thought leadership, and research competitor positioning.

•	Travel & Personal Admin — Book travel (domestic and international), manage personal appointments, coordinate household admin, handle remote errands, and manage subscriptions.

•	AI & Automation — Use Claude, ChatGPT, Zapier, and similar tools to accelerate workflows, automate repeatable processes, and continuously improve efficiency.



What We’re Looking For

•	3+ years as an EA or VA supporting a senior leader

•	Exceptional written and verbal English — you’ll be writing as the GM

•	Strong commercial awareness and ability to understand business context quickly

title: Dental Dentrix Biller
description:
Dental Biller (Dentrix) — Part-time to Full-time (20–40 hrs/week)

Location: Remote (must have reliable internet and quiet work environment)

Schedule: Must work during our office business hours (Pacific Time).



About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced Dental Biller who knows their way around Dentrix (minimum requirement) and can own the full billing cycle—from verifying eligibility to clean claim submission, patient ledgers, and persistent A/R follow-up. If you thrive on accuracy, speed, and getting claims paid the first time, we want to meet you.



Key Responsibilities

Insurance & Patient Ledgers: Maintain accurate patient ledgers, apply payments/adjustments, manage refunds, and resolve discrepancies.

A/R Management: Work aging reports (30/60/90+), reduce outstanding balances, and document all follow-ups with payers and patients.

Eligibility & Benefits: Verify insurance eligibility and detailed plan benefits; enter benefits into Dentrix and update coverage tables/fee schedules.

Claims & Attachments: Create, scrub, and submit clean claims; attach required X-rays, perio charts, and narratives; track and resolve denials.

Posting & Reconciliation: Post EOBs/ERAs accurately, reconcile deposits, and balance daily/weekly reports.

Data Entry & Audits: Keep patient and insurance data current; run periodic audits for accuracy and compliance.

Patient Billing: Generate patient statements, manage payment plans, and communicate balances professionally and empathetically.



Must-Haves

2+ years dental billing experience in a U.S. dental practice or RCM service.

Dentrix proficiency (required).

Proven experience with insurance eligibility, entering benefits into software, full A/R, and patient ledger management.

Strong knowledge of CDT codes, PPO policies, secondary coordination of benefits, and common denial reasons.

HIPAA-compliant work practices and high attention to detail.

Excellent written and verbal communication.

Ability to work live during our office business hours (Pacific Time).



Nice-to-Haves

Experience with Eaglesoft or Open Dental in addition to Dentrix.

Familiarity with clearinghouses (e.g., Vyne, ClaimConnect, DentalXChange) and e-attachments.

Prior remote work experience with measurable A/R reduction results.



Tools You’ll Use

Dentrix (required)

Clearinghouse/e-attachments platform

Secure communications (HIPAA compliant)

Spreadsheet/reporting tools for A/R tracking



Hours & Compensation

20–40 hours per week, with potential to scale based on performance and practice needs.



How to Apply

Please send:

Your resume (PDF)

A brief note detailing your Dentrix experience and monthly A/R impact you’ve achieved

Two professional references

A 60–90 second introduction video: introduce yourself, summarize your Dentrix experience, and share a quick A/R win. Include a shareable link.



Quick Screening Questions (include with your application)

How many years have you worked in dental billing and with Dentrix specifically?

Describe your process for verifying eligibility and entering benefits into Dentrix—including downgrades and frequency limitations.

What KPIs do you track for A/R (e.g., % over 90 days)? Share a recent result you’re proud of.

Which clearinghouse and e-attachment tools have you used?

Are you available for 20–40 hrs/week and able to work during our office business hours (PT)?

Please include a link to your 60–90s introduction video.

title: Full-Time Virtual Paralegal — Personal Injury Litigation
description:
LOCATION: Remote



SCHEDULE: Monday–Thursday 9am–5pm PST (California time), Friday 9am–1pm PST (California time) — non-negotiable



COMPENSATION: Competitive, based on experience



ABOUT THE ROLE:



You will be supporting a California personal injury litigation attorney managing approximately 30 active cases. This role requires someone who already understands US personal injury litigation — pleadings, discovery, demand packages, medical records — and can hit the ground running with minimal ramp-up on fundamentals.

We are looking for someone detail-obsessed, tech-fluent, and genuinely communicative. You will be on Zoom during working hours for collaboration and communication. This is not a background task role — you will be actively engaged throughout the day.



RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Draft litigation documents including pleadings, shells, and proofs of service from templates and from scratch

- Propound and assist with responding to discovery (interrogatories, requests for production, requests for admission)

- Serve documents and manage proof of service tracking

- Calendar deadlines, court dates, and discovery cutoffs in Outlook

- Organize and manage
 correspondence

- Request and organize medical records and bills

- Coordinate requests with internal firm staff

- Assist in assembling settlement demand packages

- Maintain and organize case files in Filevine

- Over time: build SOPs and templates to systematize firm workflows



REQUIREMENTS:



- Minimum 2 years of experience as a paralegal or legal virtual assistant for a US personal injury litigation firm. This is a firm requirement and is not negotiable. Please do not apply if you do not have this experience.

- Solid understanding of PI litigation fundamentals — pleadings, discovery, demand packages, medical records, service of process

- Exceptional written and spoken English — you must be able to understand and execute complex legal instructions accurately and independently. Non-native English speakers are welcome to apply, but exceptional English proficiency is required and non-negotiable.

- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word and Adobe Acrobat. If you are not highly comfortable in both, please do not apply.

- Tech fluent — you must be able to learn new software independently without hand-holding. This is non-negotiable.

- Extreme attention to detail — you catch errors before they become problems

- Highly communicative and responsive during working hours

- You must be available to work Monday–Thursday 9am–5pm and Friday 9am–1pm Pacific Standard Time (California, USA). This is a firm requirement and is not negotiable. Please do not apply if you cannot commit to these hours.



PREFERRED:



- Experience with Filevine or similar case management software (Clio, MyCase, Litify)

- California litigation experience

- Experience creating SOPs and workflow templates



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF:



- You do not have at least 2 years of paralegal or legal VA experience at a US personal injury firm

- You have never worked in US litigation and are hoping to learn on the job

- Your English proficiency is conversational but not professional and precise

- You need someone to walk you through new technology rather than figuring it out yourself

- You are not comfortable being on Zoom and actively communicating throughout the day

- You are not available to work Monday–Thursday 9am–5pm and Friday 9am–1pm Pacific Standard Time (California, USA)



HOW TO APPLY:

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:



- A short paragraph (5-8 sentences) describing a litigation matter you worked on — what type of case it was, what your specific role was, and what documents or tasks you handled

- Subject line of your application
 must read exactly: "PI Paralegal Application — [Your Name]"



Applications that do not follow these instructions exactly will not be reviewed.

This role is critical to revenue.



Role Overview



We are hiring a full-time Appointment Setter with experience scheduling for health clinics, med spas, or wellness clinics. Your primary responsibility is to immediately contact inbound leads, qualify them, and get them scheduled for consultations using phone calls and SMS.



This is not an admin role.

This is a speed-to-lead, high-urgency role.





Responsibilities

- Make outbound calls and follow up persistently until contact is made

- Qualify leads and schedule appointments accurately

- Use HighLevel (GoHighLevel) to manage leads and calendars

- Update appointments and notes in OptiMantra (EHR)

- Maintain HIPAA-compliant documentation

- Communicate clearly and professionally with patients

- Work CST business hours consistently





Required Experience



- You MUST have experience scheduling for health clinics, med spas, or wellness clinics

- Strong spoken and written English

Comfortable making high-volume outbound calls

- You MUST have experience with HighLevel (GoHighLevel)

- Experience or familiarity with EHR systems (OptiMantra preferred)

- Understanding of HIPAA and patient confidentiality

- Reliable internet, headset, and quiet work environment





What We Care Most About



Speed to lead (fast response wins)

Follow-up discipline

Accuracy and organization

Professional patient communication

Reliability during CST hours





Schedule



Full-time

Monday–Friday | 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM Central Standard Time (CST)



Voice Sample Requirement (Required)



Please record a 30–60 second voice sample answering the following:

“Hi, this is [your name]. I’m calling to follow up on your request for a consultation with our clinic. I wanted to see if you were available to talk now or if there’s a better time later today.”





How to Apply

- Your experience scheduling for health clinics or med spas

- Please confirm you have experience working in GoHighLevel

- Confirmation you can work CST hours full-time

- A voice recording (30–60 seconds) following the instructions above

title: Amazon Advertising Specialist (PPC Manager)
description:
About the Role

We're looking for a sharp, results-driven Amazon Advertising Specialist who doesn't just manage campaigns — they own them. You'll be responsible for the full advertising lifecycle of our luxury Amazon brands, from strategy and execution to weekly reporting and hitting aggressive growth targets. If you understand how to market premium products without cheapening the brand, and you love turning ad spend into revenue, this role is for you.

What You'll Be Doing

You'll take complete ownership of our Amazon PPC campaigns across Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and Sponsored Display. This means building campaigns from scratch, optimizing existing ones, and making data-backed decisions daily. You'll manage campaigns inside Pacvue, leveraging its automation, rules, and reporting features to run efficient, scalable advertising. Every week, you'll deliver clear, actionable reports that show what's working, what isn't, and what you're doing about it. You'll own our brand presence on Amazon -  including competitor research and monitoring, keyword strategy, and listing alignment - and you'll be directly accountable for hitting our ACOS, TACOS, and revenue targets. When targets are missed, we expect you to know why and have a plan.

You're a Great Fit If You

Have at least 2 years of hands-on Amazon PPC experience managing real ad budgets, with specific experience in the luxury or premium goods space. You understand that luxury brands require a different advertising posture — protecting brand perception, targeting the right customer, and avoiding discount-driven tactics that erode brand equity. You have direct, working experience with Pacvue and can hit the ground running without a learning curve. You're comfortable inside Amazon Seller Central and the advertising console, and you understand keyword research, bid strategy, search term harvesting, and negative keyword management deeply. You can build and maintain weekly performance reports in Excel or Google Sheets that are clean and easy to understand. You communicate proactively -  if something is going wrong, you raise it early, not after the fact.

title: Supply Chain Planner
description:
Supply Chain Planner (Remote – Philippines Based)



Full-Time | Remote | Philippines

We are seeking an experienced and highly analytical Supply Chain Planner to manage forecasting, inventory planning, procurement coordination, and supply chain reporting across our growing business.

This is a fully remote role based in the Philippines.



We are looking for someone commercially minded, highly proficient in Excel, confident working independently, and capable of building structured planning processes from the ground up. This role requires someone who can think ahead, identify risks early, and proactively solve supply and demand challenges.



Key Responsibilities

Forecasting & Demand Planning

• Build and maintain a rolling 12-month forecast across:

o Finished goods

o Raw materials

o Packaging & consumables

o GWPs and promotional items

• Analyze sales trends by market, channel, and SKU

• Incorporate promotions and product launches into forecasts

• Continuously improve forecast accuracy and track variance



Inventory & Supply Planning

• Monitor inventory health across warehouse and 3PL locations

• Manage stock coverage to prevent stockouts and overstock

• Identify slow-moving and aged inventory risks

• Recommend reorder quantities based on forecast and supplier lead times



Procurement & Supplier Coordination

• Raise and manage purchase orders

• Track supplier lead times and on-time performance

• Maintain supplier performance scorecards

• Flag supply risks early and propose mitigation plans



Reporting & Data Analysis

• Own weekly and monthly reporting including:

o Sales performance by market

o Forecast accuracy

o Inventory levels and stock coverage

o COGS tracking

o Backorder and stockout analysis

• Build automated Excel dashboards

• Provide data-driven insights to support commercial decisions



S&OP Process Support

• Prepare reporting and analysis for monthly S&OP meetings

• Highlight supply risks, demand shifts, and inventory gaps

• Track action items across departments



Systems & Process Improvement

• Improve forecasting models and planning templates

• Support Cin7 system enhancements

• Document and streamline planning SOPs

• Identify automation opportunities



What We’re Looking For

Essential Experience:

• 3+ years in supply planning, demand planning, inventory planning, or supply chain analysis

• Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, complex formulas, dashboards)

• Strong analytical and numerical capability

• Experience working with ERP or inventory systems

• Experience working remotely and managing deadlines independently

Highly Desirable

• Experience supporting S&OP processes

• Experience with global suppliers and freight coordination

• Experience in eCommerce, FMCG, beauty, or consumer goods



Key Competencies

• Strong commercial thinking

• Highly organized and structured

• Proactive problem solver

• Detail-oriented (Excel skills are a must)

• Comfortable presenting insights to leadership

• Self-starter with strong accountability



Application Instructions:

Please fill out this form:





Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you!

title: Agency GHL Automation & CRM Specialist
description:
WHO WE ARE

Candor Marketing is a nationally focused agency that builds predictable patient pipelines exclusively for aesthetic and wellness clinics. We don't sell marketing services — we sell outcomes. We guarantee results, we operate on documented systems, and we build everything on the Hormozi framework: make the offer so good that saying no feels stupid, deliver so much value that clients never want to leave, and build systems that scale without depending on any one person.



We hire specialists. Not generalists. If you're the best at what you do and you want to be part of building a nationally recognized brand, keep reading.



THE ROLE

You are the engine behind every client account. You build and manage the complete GoHighLevel infrastructure that turns ad clicks into booked appointments — automatically, reliably, and at a standard that makes our clients feel like they have a world-class tech team in their corner.



This is a builder role. You own the system.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Build and manage all client GoHighLevel sub-accounts including pipelines, automations, SMS and
 follow-up sequences, reactivation campaigns, reputation management workflows, and live reporting dashboards.



Connect all client landing pages — built externally in Webflow, Lovable, or ClickFunnels — to GoHighLevel so every form submission triggers the correct pipeline stage, automation sequence, and contact record instantly and accurately.

Build automated follow-up sequences that convert leads into booked appointments without any manual effort from the clinic. Every sequence needs to feel human, move with urgency, and reflect the value-dense Hormozi style offer the client is running.

Run patient reactivation campaigns into existing client databases every 60 days — segmented, sequenced, and built to generate found revenue with zero ad spend.



Build and maintain real-time dashboards every client can check from their phone showing exactly what their investment is producing. No vanity metrics. Revenue, leads, booked appointments, cost per acquisition.

Document every workflow, automation, and system you build in our SOP library. If you get hit by a bus tomorrow, someone else can run your accounts by end of day. That's the standard.



WHAT YOU NEED

Minimum 2 years of hands-on GoHighLevel experience with complex multi-step automations and full sub-account builds. Proof of work required — no exceptions.



Experience integrating GoHighLevel with third party platforms via Zapier or Make.



Familiarity connecting external landing page platforms like Webflow, Lovable, or ClickFunnels to GHL form submissions and automation triggers.



Strong understanding of lead nurture logic, pipeline architecture, and conversion principles.

Experience with clinic or healthcare software like Jane App, Mindbody, or PatientNow is a strong plus.



WHO YOU ARE

You are obsessively organized, proactive, and you take ownership. You don't wait for things to break. You catch problems before clients do. You communicate clearly in writing, work independently without hand-holding, and you build systems you're proud of — clean architecture, properly named automations, documented workflows.



You understand that in the Hormozi framework every system we build needs to be so dialed in, so value-dense, and so results-oriented that our clients would feel crazy leaving. You build with that standard in mind every single time.



COMPENSATION

Strictly hourly. $25–$45/hour based on experience. Hours tracked and submitted weekly. Workload scales with our client roster. Strong performers move into retainer arrangements as the agency grows.



HOW TO APPLY

Apply with "Candor Marketing - GHL Specialist" as your subject line to be proof you have read the description. ALL applications that do not do this will be discarded immediately. We also require you include a brief description of the most complex GHL system you've ever built plus two or three examples of your work — screenshots, a Loom walkthrough. No proof of work, no consideration.

title: Copywriter
description:
About Us



We partner with individuals, teams, and organisations to build communication, leadership, sales, and performance capabilities through world-class training and professional development. Our work spans industries and career stages, from emerging leaders to executive teams, and our content needs to speak to both people and businesses with clarity, credibility, and warmth.



The Opportunity



We’re looking for an experienced B2B + B2C Copywriter who can turn insights, outcomes, and program value into compelling copy that drives action, without hype. You’ll write across the funnel: lead generation, nurture, conversion, and retention.



This is an ideal role for someone who understands the difference between writing for a buyer (HR/L&D, managers, executives) and writing for a participant (individual learners), and can adapt voice, structure, and persuasion techniques accordingly.



You’ll support a mix of projects including:



-
 sequences (lead nurture, event promotion, re-engagement, onboarding)

- Lead magnets (guides, checklists, short ebooks, landing-page assets)

- Website copy (program pages, landing pages, SEO-informed content)

- Video ad scripts 

- Social media content 

- Sales proposals 



What Success Looks Like



- Copy that is clear, structured, benefit-led, and aligned with a premium, trusted brand

- Strong conversion-focused writing that still feels human and credible

- Messaging that differentiates between B2B decision-maker needs (risk, ROI, outcomes, implementation) and B2C motivations (confidence, career growth, communication, leadership)

- Consistent quality and fast turnaround, with thoughtful questions when needed



About You



You’re likely a great fit if you have:

- Proven copywriting experience across B2B and B2C, ideally in services, education, training, coaching, or professional development

- Strong portfolio examples across
, landing pages, and conversion copy

- Ability to write in a confident, professional voice that feels modern, not “salesy”

- Excellent attention to detail and the ability to self-edit ruthlessly

- Comfort working with briefs, brand guidelines, and stakeholder feedback

- Bonus: familiarity with positioning outcomes, program benefits, and behaviour-change messaging



How to Apply



Please send:

- A short intro (2–4 paragraphs)

- 3–5 relevant portfolio samples (links or PDFs), ideally including
 + landing page or sales copy

- Your availability (hours per week or capacity)

Compensation & Perks:

Workload: Minimum expectation is 200 videos per month.



Training: Full, comprehensive training is provided.

title: Tax Preparer (Part-Time | Remote | Seasonal)
description:
Position: Tax Preparer (Part-Time | Remote | Seasonal)

Location: Remote

Hours: Part-time, seasonal (tax season)

Compensation: TBD

Type: 1099 Subcontractor



================================================



Looking for meaningful tax work with a firm that actually thinks strategically?



Join a small, focused remote team where your attention to detail and technical skills directly impact real clients building real wealth.



================================================

ABOUT US

================================================



At OpenPath Finance, we help business owners, Bitcoiners, and freedom-minded entrepreneurs take control of their finances, reduce their tax burden, and build lasting wealth.



We're not here just to file returns. We work closely with clients year-round to strategically plan their tax and financial operations and ensure those plans are reflected in their books and filings. We care about the details because they drive real results.



We're a small, focused team that values thoughtful action, steady progress, and full ownership of our work. We're not looking for perfection, but we do look for people who take initiative, ask smart questions, and follow through.



If you're someone who pursues purpose, embraces growth, and wants to contribute to meaningful work with real impact, you'll feel right at home here. Learn more at 
.



================================================

ROLE OVERVIEW

================================================



We're hiring a Tax Preparer to join our team during tax season. You'll be assigned a mix of personal and business returns to prepare, and you'll also serve as the first-level reviewer on your teammate's work before anything reaches the firm owner and tax advisor.



The goal is simple: by the time a return reaches the tax advisor for final sign-off, it has been prepared carefully and reviewed thoroughly. His role is a quick final check, not a detailed review. That standard is on you and your teammate to uphold together.



This is a technical, detail-oriented role with real accountability. You'll work independently, manage your own queue, and communicate clearly when something needs escalation.



================================================

RESPONSIBILITIES

================================================



- Prepare assigned U.S. tax returns accurately and on time, including complex 1040s, 1065s, and 1120-S returns

- Perform first-level peer review on teammate's prepared returns before submission to firm owner

- Document review notes clearly so the final reviewer can move quickly and confidently

- Meet turnaround standard: returns must be finalized within two weeks of receiving a completed organizer

- Communicate proactively when client information is missing, unclear, or when a return requires escalation

- Follow firm workflows in TaxDome and prepare returns in Drake



================================================

REQUIREMENTS

================================================



- 5+ years of hands-on U.S. tax preparation and review experience

- Strong technical knowledge of complex Forms 1040, 1065, and 1120-S, 1120

- Experience working remotely for a U.S.-based CPA firm or tax practice

- Proficient in Drake Tax software

- Communicates clearly and professionally in written English -- client-facing communication is a core part of this role, including status updates, document requests, and follow-up questions

- Works independently, meets deadlines, and follows through without being chased

- Available during U.S. business hours, with morning Central Time availability required for weekly tea
etings and working sessions with their team pod



================================================

PREFERRED

================================================



- Experience reviewing others' tax work, not just preparing

- Familiarity with TaxDome or similar tax workflow platforms

- Knowledge of Bitcoin, Bitcoin mining, and related tax and accounting considerations



================================================

GROWTH PATH

================================================



This starts as a seasonal, part-time engagement. For the right person, there is a clear path to increased hours, year-round work, and a more senior role within the firm as we grow. We invest in people who take ownership and grow with us.



================================================

HOW TO APPLY

================================================



To apply, click the Apply button and include the following in your message:



1. A link to your resume (Google Docs or Dropbox)

2. A short note -- no more than 2 paragraphs -- on why this role interests you and what kind of tax work you've handled most

3. Answer this question in 3-5 sentences: Describe a time you caught a significant error in a tax return, whether your own or someone else's. What was it and how did you handle it?



We review written responses first. Strong communicators who demonstrate real tax experience will move to the next stage.

title: Video Editor (Premiere Pro) — YouTube Shorts, Reels & Long-Form Content
description:
About the Role



I run a video production business creating content for YouTube creators and brands. I need a reliable, detail-oriented video editor to handle short-form content (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels) and straightforward long-form YouTube edits on an ongoing, long-term basis — not a one-off project.



You will primarily be editing for one client to start, with additional editing work from other clients as the relationship grows. This is a role with room to expand in both scope and compensation as my business scales.



Important Note About Content: The primary client you'll be editing for produces right-leaning American political commentary. The content includes strong opinions, humor, and topics that some may find controversial or offensive. You must be comfortable working with this type of material professionally, regardless of your personal views. If political content would make you uncomfortable or affect the quality of your work, this is not the right fit — no hard feelings.



What You'll Be Editing

Short-form videos (YouTube Shorts / Instagram Reels):



30–90 second clips cut from longer livestreams and recorded content

Talking head commentary with b-roll, text overlays, and music

Full styled captions/subtitles (you will handle transcription and captioning — style specs provided)

Comedy and timing are a big part of what makes these work — you need to recognize what's funny and how to land a punchline through editing



Long-form YouTube videos (8–20 minutes):



Edited from streams and recorded content

Cuts, pacing, basic color correction, basic transitions, and light graphics

No heavy motion graphics required



B-Roll Sourcing (Both Short-Form and Long-Form):

This is a key part of the role. You will be responsible for finding and incorporating appropriate b-roll into your edits. This includes:



Researching and downloading relevant news clips from YouTube — if the video covers a recent event, you need to find footage of that event to edit into the video

Finding images of specific people, places, or i
 referenced in the content

Using stock footage where appropriate — you must have access to a stock footage platform (Storyblocks, Artlist, Canva Pro, or similar)

General awareness of American politics and current events is important, OR you must have excellent research skills to quickly find relevant visuals for topics you may not be familiar with



As the role grows, you may also edit similar content for other clients — short-form clips, reels, and simple long-form edits across different niches.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Adobe Premiere Pro — You must own or have reliable access to Premiere Pro. You will deliver both finished exports AND the Premiere Pro project file (.prproj) with all assets organized so I can go back in and make revisions if needed. Access to the broader Adobe Suite (After Effects, Photoshop, etc.) is a plus but not required.



Descript — You must have a Descript subscription for transcription and caption/subtitle work. If you don't currently have one, you must be willing to get one. I will provide the exact caption style specifications.

Stock footage access — You must have a subscription to a stock footage/media platform (Storyblocks, Artlist, Canva Pro, or equivalent) for sourcing b-roll where news clips or specific footage aren't available.



Excellent English comprehension — this is absolutely critical. The primary creator you'll be editing has a very thick Southern American accent. Even native English speakers sometimes need to replay sections to catch what he's saying. You need to be confident in your ability to accurately transcribe and caption heavily accented, fast-paced American English. If English comprehension is not one of your strongest skills, this role will be extremely difficult and frustrating for both of us. Please be honest with yourself about this.



Research skills — You need to be resourceful. If the creator references a news story, a political figure, or a past i
, you must be able to quickly research it and find relevant images, clips, or footage to include as b-roll in the edit.



Familiarity with American pop culture, internet humor, 
s, and current events is a strong plus. The content includes references to trending topics, political figures, and internet culture. You don't need to be an expert, but awareness helps you make better editing choices and find better b-roll.



Reliable internet connection and ability to download/upload large video files regularly.



Available to start within 1 week.



Nice to Have (Not Required)



AI image/video generation skills — Some edits benefit from AI-generated visuals, especially for comedy segments where traditional b-roll doesn't exist. If you have experience with AI tools (Midjourney, Runway, Kling, etc.), that's a major bonus. If not, I'm willing to train you on this, as it's my specialty.



Skills & Qualities I'm Looking For



The #1 quality I need is someone who can watch 5–10 existing videos on a channel and match that editing style independently. I don't want to micromanage every cut.



Specifically:



Strong sense of pacing and comedic timing — knowing when to hold on a reaction, when to cut, when to let a 
nt breathe, and how to land a joke

Ability to emulate an already established editing style by studying existing content — not imposing your own creative preferences

Resourceful b-roll sourcing — you can find relevant, appropriate visuals quickly without being told exactly what to search for

Basic color correction skills

Comfortable with basic transitions — clean and intentional, nothing flashy

Self-directed work ethic — you study the training materials, ask smart questions when something is unclear, and deliver work that doesn't require heavy revision





What I Provide



Detailed training recordings — I have multi-hour screen recordings showing my complete editing process for both short-form and long-form content, start to finish. These cover everything: how I select clips from streams, how I pace edits, how I handle captions, how I source b-roll, and the specific style choices that matter. Additional training recordings will be added as we work together.

Style guides and caption specifications — You won't be guessing. The visual style, caption style, and editing approach are documented.

Clear, specific feedback — If something needs adjustment, I'll tell you exactly what and why. I don't expect perfection on day one, but I do expect quick improvement and consistent effort to match the established style. To confirm you've read this far, please include the word "mangoes" somewhere in your application message.

Example content — Before you start any edit, I will provide reference videos so you can see exactly what the finished product should look and feel like.



Compensation & Payment



$600–$1,000/month USD depending on experience, skill level, and weekly workload. Higher pay for editors who can handle more volume independently and deliver work that requires minimal revision.



Payment schedule: Weekly, paid after each week of completed work. This is standard practice — you work, I review, I pay. No upfront payment required from either side. After the first 1–2 months, we can transition to biweekly or monthly if we both prefer.



Payment method: EasyPay (Payoneer), PayPal, or Wise — we can discuss what works best for you.

This is a long-term position with room to grow in both scope and compensation as my business takes on new clients.



How to Apply (Follow These Steps Exactly)



1. Use exactly 10 Apply Points when submitting your application. Applications with any other number of points will not be considered.



2. Send a link to your portfolio OR 2–3 samples of short-form video content you've edited (YouTube Shorts, Reels, TikToks, etc.). Bonus points if any samples include b-roll that you sourced yourself.



3. Confirm that you have access to Adobe Premiere Pro, Descript (or willingness to get it), and a stock footage platform



4. Confirm you are comfortable editing right-leaning American political commentary content.



5. On a scale of 1–10, how would you rate your ability to understand heavily accented American English? Be honest — this will be tested during the trial.



6. Briefly describe your process when you're given a new channel to edit for — how do you learn and match the style?



7. Do you have any experience with AI image or video generation tools? If yes, which ones?



Hiring Process



Selected applicants will receive a paid test task ($15–$25) before any ongoing commitment is made. You'll edit one real short-form video so we can both evaluate whether the fit is right. This test is paid regardless of outcome.

title: Inbound Appointment Setter & Admin for US Junk Removal Company (Near?Native English Only)
description:
About the Role

We run a growing junk removal & light demolition company in Florida (USA). Most of our leads are high?intent inbound calls from Google. Your #1 job is to answer/return those calls fast, understand what the customer really needs, and book them into our schedule. When phones are quiet, you’ll handle light admin tasks.



Salary: 

$900–$1,200 per month (full?time) + performance bonuses based on booked & completed jobs. 

Salary once fully ramped with incentives can reach $1,500.



Responsibilities



Answer inbound calls from US customers and call back missed calls quickly.

Understand what the caller actually wants (example: difference between “where can I drop my brush?” vs “can you haul this brush away for me?”) and respond appropriately.

Ask a few simple questions, collect photos when needed, and book jobs into our calendar in the correct time windows.

Run our 7?day follow?up playbook on unbooked leads: calls, texts, and confirmations using our CRM (GoHighLevel).

Confirm next?day jobs, reschedule when needed, and keep the schedule tight for our crews.

Do light admin work between calls (updating notes, simple spreadsheets, basic
 tasks).

Requirements



Excellent spoken and written English with near?native / neutral American accent.

Strong listening and comprehension skills. You must catch subtle differences in what people say and ask clarifying questions.

Prior experience on the phone with US/UK/AU customers (appointment setting, customer service, or call center). Ideally 3 years on the phone with us/uk/eu customers.

Comfortable working US hours (roughly 9am–5pm US Eastern,  Monday to Saturday).

Reliable internet, backup connection, and a quiet place to take calls.

Coachable, reliable, and willing to follow scripts AND use judgment when real life doesn’t match the script.

Nice to Have



Experience with home services (plumbing, HVAC, cleaning, junk removal, etc.).

Experience using CRMs like GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or similar.

Compensation



Full?time, 50 hours/week.

Competitive salary based on experience, paid monthly (we will discuss your desired rate).

Long?term role for the right person; we invest in training and want you with us for years, not months.

How to Apply (follow these steps exactly)



Subject line: Appointment Setter – [Your Name]

Include:

Your resume.

Your expected monthly salary in USD for full?time work.

Voice sample (required):

Record 45–60 seconds (Vocaroo, Loom, etc.) introducing yourself and reading this scenario in your own words:

“A caller says: ‘Can I drop my brush off somewhere?’

Please respond as if you work for our junk removal company. Clarify what they mean and explain what we can or cannot do for them.”



Send the link in your
.

Screenshot of your internet speed test.

Applications that do not follow all steps will not be considered.

title: Appointment Setter Wanted – Interviews This Week
description:
CLIENT SALES REP - FULL-TIME POSITION FOR HIGH PERFORMERS ONLY



WARNING: This isn't your typical "dial and smile" appointment setting role. We're building the #1 renovation growth agency in Australia, and we need absolute killers who thrive under pressure and deliver results. If you're looking for an easy paycheck, keep scrolling.



About ReynMedia



We're a renovator-specific growth agency helping high-ticket renovators ($20K-$100K+ AUD projects) generate consistent revenue. Our clients close $100K+ monthly because we don't mess around with cheap leads or empty promises.



We're scaling FAST: 10 clients now, 50 ASAP, 100 by end of 2026.



Your Mission As Client Sales Rep:



You're the bridge between high-value homeowners and life-changing renovation projects. Every call you make impacts thousands of families getting their dream homes.



Core responsibility: Call and qualify 100% of inbound leads to achieve 30-40% qualification rate.



What You'll Do Daily:



- Call new leads immediately when they come in (speed matters)

- Follow up with existing pipeline prospects

- Qualify homeowners for $20K+ renovation projects

- Track Leads Via GoHighLevel CRM

- Send Leads To Our Clients Directly Via Slack

- Communicate With Our Clients On Lead Specific Information

- Deliver an exceptional customer experience on every call

- Track performance and submit daily reports





Schedule & Compensation:



Hours: 9am-5pm Australian Eastern Daylight Time (full-time)

Base + Commission: $5/AUD + $6 commission for every lead you qualify

Uncapped earning potential - our killers make serious money ($600+ AUD per week)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- 1+ years phone-based B2C sales/appointment setting experience

- Proven ability to build rapport and trust quickly

- Experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred, training provided)

- Elite level organisation and consistency

- Sales-driven mindset with positive attitude

- Available during mandatory hours



BONUS: Prior experience with renovators/home services



Our Culture (Can You Handle It?):

- Pure devotion to delivering best-in-class service

- Extreme accountability - we call each other out

- Elite standards - we don't settle for second place

- Growth focused - personal and professional development

- Fun - a work environment our team loves working in every day



This role is an entry point to higher positions. We promote from within based on performance, commitment, and competency.



Don't Apply If...

- You can't handle direct feedback

- You're just looking for any paycheck

- You don't thrive in high-performance environments

- You can't commit to consistent daily activity



How To Apply:



1. Fill out application form: 
/
. MANDATORY: Record 60-second Vocaroo audio explaining why you'll crush this role

3. We respond within 24-48 hours if you advance to group interview



Applications without Vocaroo submissions videos are automatically rejected.



Spots fill fast when we post these positions. Apply immediately if you're serious about joining the ReynMedia team and helping renovators and homeowners achieve their dreams.

title: Appointment Setter
description:
We are based in Melbourne Australia. We are looking for a highly disciplined and hardworking Appointment Setter to join our growing education consultancy team. This is a high-volume outbound calling role. We are expecting you to make at least 20 calls per hour. If you are not comfortable making large volume of calls daily, this role is not for you. We are not looking for “talent”. We are looking for hardworking, consistency, discipline, and commitment.



Your Role

• Call 160+ warm leads daily (8 hours shift)

• Follow structured call scripts

• Book at least 10 qualified appointments for Senior Consultants daily

• Maintain accurate call records

• Handle objections calmly and professionally

• Follow up consistently until contact is made



This is a performance-based role. Only committed individuals should apply.



We Are Looking For Someone Who:

• Speaks clear, neutral English (minimal accent)

• Has strong phone confidence

• Is mentally strong and not easily discouraged

• Is comfortable with repetitive work

• Is available 20-30 hours a week

• Wants long-term growth



What We Offer

• Stable long-term opportunity

• A minimum of 20 hours and maximum of 40 hours per week

• Salary reviews Every quarterly

• Growth opportunity into Consultant role (for top performers)

We never had payment delay issues. You will always be paid on time.



Application Process (Important)

Due to high application volume, we only review candidates who complete the following:

1. Record a 1-minute self-introduction video in English.

2. Record a 30-second cold call simulation using any pretend script



Send your video link together with your CV. Applications without video submission will NOT be reviewed.
