title: Real Estate Transaction Coordination
description:
Summary:

We are seeking an experienced Transaction Coordinator to manage wholesale real estate transactions and flip projects from contract to closing. This role requires someone who is highly organized, proactive, and confident communicating with all parties involved in the transaction.



Key Responsibilities:

- Transaction Management

- Manage transactions from executed contract through closing

- Stay up to date on title status, open items, and closing timelines

- Follow up consistently with title companies, attorneys, and lenders



Communication:

- Serve as a primary point of contact for buyers, sellers, agents, attorneys, and title companies

- Provide clear updates to internal tea
mbers

- Ensure all parties remain aligned on deadlines and next steps

- Coordination & Administrative Tasks

- Schedule walkthroughs, inspections, and closings as needed

- Assist with Use & Occupancy agreements, escrow holds, and post-closing matters

- Coordinate property access with agents,buyers and sellers

- Handle miscellaneous transaction-related tasks to keep deals moving smoothly



Documentation:

- Collect, review, and organize contracts, addenda, disclosures, and closing documents

- Ensure documents are fully executed and delivered on time



Required Skills & Qualifications:

- 2+ years of transaction coordination experience (REQUIRED)



- Strong background in real estate transactions (wholesale experience strongly preferred)



- Excellent communication skills



- Very strong English proficiency (written and verbal)



- Highly organized with strong attention to detail



- Ability to manage multiple transactions simultaneously



- Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment



Please submit the following to be considered for this role:



- Your resume



- A face recording video briefly explaining:

   a.) Your transaction coordination experience

   b.) The types of real estate transactions you’ve worked on

   c.) A short introduction about yourself and what you enjoy doing outside of work



Videos do not need to be long—2–3 minutes is perfect. This helps us better understand your communication skills and experience.

title: eCommerce VSL Video Editor
description:
Company Description



We are a fast-growing ecommerce store that sells different products through such acquisition platforms as Meta ads, Google ads, Amazon, Klaviyo, Tiktok, Instagram, etc.







Role Description



This is a remote contract role for an Ecommerce Video Editor. The video editor will be responsible for editing new VSL, UGC, mashup, and other types of videos on weekly basis using the scripts provided, and offering data-driven insights to shape overall strategy. In this role, you will also be tasked with honing new skills such as working with AI tools, creating motion designs, researching the content on Instagram, Tiktok, Youtube etc.







Qualifications



Proven experience in creating high-converting video ads for ecommerce brands, with a strong understanding of VSLs and UGC content editing.

Strong analytical skills to assess video performance metrics and optimize for engagement, conversion rates, and return on ad spend (ROAS)

Deep proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, After Effects, or similar) and familiarity with motion graphics, transitions, and dynamic text overlays.

Experience in editing videos for paid media platforms, including
 Ads, Google Ads (Performance Max etc), and YouTube Ads.

At least 3 years of experience in ecommerce video editing, specifically for direct-to-consumer (DTC) and VSLs (long video-sales letters)



Excellent command of English (C1 level or higher) for seamless team communication and collaboration.



Availability to work on Eastern Standard Time (EST) with flexibility for tight deadlines and occasional weekend work.

Key traits we value: proactiveness, creativity, adaptability, attention to detail, and the ability to take brand storytelling to the next level.





How to Apply:



Option 1 - Google Form (preferred): Please complete this form if you are interested:










Option 2 - No Google Form: To apply, please click on the "Apply" button on the listing and follow the instructions to submit your resume in English. Ensure your resume highlights your relevant experience to clearly demonstrate how your skills meet the specific requirements outlined in the job description.

title: Final Cut Pro (Mac) Video Editor + Storyteller (Podcasts / Real Estate / Doc-Style) — Fast Internet Required
description:
Job Type



**Full-time (40 hrs/week)**

**Long-term position**



Overview



We’re hiring a **high-skill video editor who is also a storyteller**. You will turn raw footage into **modern, high-retention edits** for:



* **Podcasts** (full episodes + highlight clips)

* **Real estate videos** (premium, cinematic, clean)

* **Documentary / story-driven videos** (structure, emotion, pacing)



**Must edit using Final Cut Pro on a Mac.** If you don’t use Final Cut Pro, do not apply.



Editing Style We Want (Modern)



* Strong **hook / cold open**

* Tight pacing, retention cuts, punch-ins

* **Text graphics + captions** (clean + modern)

* **Speed ramps** (tasteful)

* B-roll layering, light sound design

* Basic color correction + consistent look



Responsibilities



* Edit **full podcast episodes** (30–90 min raw footage)

* Create **short-form clips** (30–90 sec) for TikTok / Reels / YouTube Shorts

* Edit **real estate** videos (15 sec–3 min)

* Select the best 
nts and improve flow (storytelling)

* Add captions, graphics, music, and b-roll as needed

* Deliver clean exports + organized project files when requested

* Follow brand guidelines and templates



Non-Negotiable Requirements



* **Mac computer + Final Cut Pro**

* Proven portfolio in **podcast editing** and/or **real estate editing** and/or **doc/story edits**

* **Fast, reliable internet** (we transfer large video files)



  * Include your **download + upload speeds** in your application

* Excellent communication and reliable daily availability



Internet Requirement (Important)



You must be able to:



* Download/upload large video files quickly

* Work with Google Drive / Dropbox / 
 (or similar)

* Maintain a stable connection (no frequent disconnects)



Work Schedule



* Full-time availability required

* Must be responsive during agreed working hours

* Weekly deadlines for episodes + clips



Pay



Please send your expected monthly salary in USD.

We will hire based on **skill + speed + value** (best rate for strong quality).



How We Hire (Paid Test)



Shortlisted candidates will do a **paid test edit** using the same footage:



* 1 short clip (30–60 sec) with captions + modern pacing

* Optional: a 60–90 sec story teaser



To Apply (REQUIRED — copy/paste and answer)



1. Confirm: **You edit on Mac using Final Cut Pro** (YES/NO)

   * 1 short clip:

title: Amazon Listing Specialist (Flat File Expert)
description:
We’re looking for a highly detail-oriented Amazon Listing Specialist with 2+ years of hands-on experience creating and maintaining Amazon listings with a strong knowledge of Amazon flat files (inventory file templates) who can confidently navigate complex category requirements (including regulated attributes like UL compliance in Lighting) and push listings live accurately and consistently.



If you’re the type of person who won’t stop until the data is correct, all the applicable fields are filled in (for maximum Amazon exposure), and the listing is fully compliant, this role is for you.





What You’ll Own:



Amazon Listing Creation & Optimization (Flat File Heavy)



Build new listings using flat files, completing all applicable attributes.

Know the difference between required vs. recommended vs. optional fields and fill them appropriately.

Understand when to use Amazon Valid Values vs. when custom entries are appropriate (and how to format them correctly).

Create and maintain variation structures (parent/child), ensuring clean, logical relationships.

 



Category Complexity for example Compliance (Lighting & Beyond)



Handle harder categories (e.g., Lighting) with additional compliance and attribute requirements.

Accurately input certification/compliance-related attributes (e.g., UL, safety claims, etc.) per Amazon policy and category rules.

Interpret category templates and adapt to different attribute needs across multiple categories.

 



Troubleshooting ,  Seller Support Case Management



Open Amazon cases that get useful, actionable answers (not copy-paste responses).

Be persistent: escalate, reframe, and follow up until the issue is resolved and the listing is live.

Diagnose errors/warnings in flat file uploads and resolve issues efficiently.

 



Quality Assurance



Spot-check live listings after upload to ensure every field populated correctly (titles, bullets, attributes, variations, compliance fields, etc.).

Catch missing attributes, suppressed listings, browse node issues, mismatched valid values, and formatting errors

Ensure that ALL fields are filled in to maximize Amazon exposure and Rufus understanding of our listing

 



Additional Amazon Ops Tasks as applicable



Inventory updates, price updates, and Amazon-related reporting tied to listing and catalog projects.

Support ongoing catalog maintenance and data updates as the Amazon business scales.

 



What We’re Looking For 



Required



2+ years Amazon listing experience with flat files

Strong understanding of:

Required vs. recommended fields

Valid values, attribute formatting, and template logic

Troubleshooting upload errors and feed processing results

Demonstrated ability to work through Amazon support to get real solutions.

Extremely detail-oriented, organized, and persistent.

Comfortable asking questions when stuck, and proactive about finding answers either through opening Amazon cases or internal company support

Strong excel skills to handle thousands of skus at a time – organizing, filtering, sorting data at speed

Works well independently but also part of a larger team!

title: Video Editor
description:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

Short-Form Video Editing (Primary)

*Edit 5–20+ short-form videos per day optimized for TikTok and TikTok Shop

*Edit short video/audio podcast (2 episodes a month)

*Create tight, fast-paced edits where cuts feel natural and almost unnoticeable

*Incorporate:

**Multiple camera angles

**Product close-ups

**Usage demonstrations

**On-screen text and captions that improve retention and conversions

*Enhance videos to match a more premium, brand-friendly aesthetic (lighting, color, polish)

*Adapt edits to current TikTok creative trends and algorithm preferences

*Utilize preferred settings in CapCut and suggest others that would make content better



Creative Input & Optimization

*Provide creative suggestions such as:

**What shots are missing

**When pacing needs to be faster

**When structure should change to improve hook and retention

*Help improve content quality and viewer retention over time, not just execute instructions



Fast Turnaround & Workflow

*Deliver edits on very tight timelines, often within 24 hours

*Organize files, exports, and versions efficiently

*Work within a fast-changing content schedule that may shift daily



AI-Assisted Editing & Localization (Future Phase)

*Learn and use AI tools to:

**Speed up editing workflows

**Assist with repurposing content

**Support future Spanish-language versions using AI voice and lip-sync tools (training provided)

*Follow new AI-based workflows as systems are implemented



Cross-Platform Repurposing (Secondary)

*Prepare videos for reposting on:

**Instagram Reels

*
 Reels

*Maintain correct formats, captions, and technical specs per platform



EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

*3+ years of video production experience

*Experience with remote team tools like Time Doctor, Slack, Trello, Google Suite, LastPass,
 and Zoom

*Excellent English skills, and able to communicate well both verbally and in writing

*Proven expertise in editing short-form TikTok content, with advanced proficiency in CapCut. (not YouTube-style long-form)

*Strong understanding of:

**TikTok pacing and hooks

**Product-driven storytelling

**TikTok Shop style content

*Ability to edit:

**Talking-head videos

**Product demos

**Lifestyle shots

**Voiceover videos

*Strong eye for:

**Timing

**Visual flow

**Brand presentation

*Content that converts sales and retains viewers

*Comfortable working in a high-volume, fast-paced environment

*Open to learning and using AI tools to improve efficiency

*Excellent organization and file management



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i7 or equivalent with 16gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 100 MBPS Download speed



Job Type: Part-Time (potentially move into full-time depending on business needs and performance ) - 4 hours daily / 20 hours weekly

Schedule: 3PM-7PM EST M-F // 4AM-8AM PHT

title: Full-Time Video Editor (Remote) - YouTube-Style Business Content - ~$1,600/mo
description:
Type: Full-Time (40 hrs/week)

Work Setup: Remote

Hours: Must work US Central Time (CT)

Pay: $1,600/month (monthly pay, growth based on performance)



What You’ll Do

We’re hiring a Video Editor to create clean, engaging edits for professional service companies in the U.S. This role is focused on retention-driven editing: pacing, B-roll, captions, music, and graphics that keep viewers watching.

You’ll also get coaching and feedback to improve quickly while working with a YouTube creator with 555,000+ subscribers.



Key Responsibilities

• Edit long-form videos into polished, modern final cuts

• Add captions/subtitles, graphics/lower thirds, music, SFX, and B-roll

• Improve retention through pacing, clean cuts, and visual variety

• Follow feedback, systems, and deadlines consistently



Required

• Strong portfolio showing clean, professional edits

• Experience with:

o Captions (timed + styled)

o Graphics (callouts/lower thirds)

o Music/SFX + clean audio levels

o B-roll selection to support the story

• Fast, reliable, and willing to learn/improve continuously



Tools

Premiere Pro preferred, but Final Cut or DaVinci Resolve is fine.

(After Effects is a plus, not required.)



Great Fit If You…

• Love making videos feel modern and easy to watch

• Can edit efficiently without sacrificing quality

• Want a long-term role with growth potential



To Apply (Please include)

1. Portfolio link (required)

2. 3–5 relevant samples (YouTube-style / business / talking-head + B-roll)

3. Your editing software + computer specs

4. Your availability and daily overlap with US Central Time (CT)

5. One paragraph: how you increase retention with your edits



Application Subject Line: “Full-Time Video Editor – Remote”

title: Amazon Image and Design Specialist
description:
About the Role



We are seeking an experienced Amazon-focused Visual Designer to create high-converting product images for our luxury brand portfolio. Our products are design-led (e.g., premium plates and tabletop items) where aesthetic appeal, heritage, craftsmanship, and brand storytelling drive purchasing decisions, not as much the technical features or functionality.



We need a designer who understands how to visually communicate desirability, quality, brand love, emotional connection, and luxury positioning on Amazon. We have thousands of images to produce, so efficiency and AI-powered workflow expertise are required .



 



 



Key Responsibilities



Design Amazon-compliant product listing images (main images, lifestyle, A+ content, infographics where appropriate).

Translate brand identity, heritage, and craftsmanship into compelling, emotional, visual narratives.

Create imagery that elevates perceived value and reinforces luxury positioning.

Develop scalable, AI-assisted workflows to produce large volumes of high-quality images efficiently.

Ensure all assets meet Amazon image guidelines and optimize for conversion.

Maintain visual consistency across multiple SKUs and collections that match the brand vibe

 



Required Experience



Proven experience designing product images specifically for Amazon marketplace listings.

Demonstrated work with luxury, premium, or heritage-driven brands.

Experience marketing design-led products (homeware, décor, tabletop, fashion, beauty, lifestyle brands, etc.) where emotional appeal outweighs technical features.

Advanced proficiency with AI image-generation tools and automation workflows to produce high-volume content quickly.

Deep understanding of conversion-focused visual strategy for Amazon.

 



 



Ideal Candidate



Understands the psychology of premium buyers, how they shop, where they research (example social media)

Can visually communicate craftsmanship, legacy, and exclusivity.

Balances brand integrity with marketplace performance.

Highly organized and able to manage large-scale asset production.

Can work independently but also within boundaries of a larger system

title: Junior Admin & Research Assistant (Execution Role)
description:
Role Overview:



This is an execution-focused role.



You will provide structured research and operational support across speaking opportunities, podcasts, grants, travel logistics, apartment hunting, doctors and clinics, restaurants, and international travel planning.



A significant portion of this role requires deep, high-level research specifically for speaking opportunities and podcast placements. This includes identifying aligned conferences, associations, bureaus, submission deadlines, and accurate decision-maker contacts.



This is not a strategy role.

You execute clearly defined tasks with precision and speed.



Core Responsibilities:



1. Research

- Find speaking opportunities, conferences, associations, and bureaus aligned with our brand

- Research podcast opportunities aligned with our brand

- Identify submission links, deadlines, speaker guidelines, and decision-makers

- Pull accurate host or organizer contact information

- Build clean, organized contact lists

- Research flights, trains, hotels, Airbnb's, apartments

- Research doctors, clinics, wellness providers, restaurants

- Filter by location, ratings, price, availability, safety, credibility, and brand alignment



2. Administrative Support

- Update and manage Google Sheets

- Organize and clean files

- Transcribe voice notes

- Create structured client decks



Tasks must be completed exactly as requested.



3. Tracking & Follow-Up

- Track submissions and outreach

- Send templated follow-ups

- Log replies

- Set reminders

- Maintain updated status sheets



Nothing falls through the cracks.



Required Skills:

- Strong reading comprehension

- Strong spreadsheet skills (Google Sheets, Excel)

- Strong Google Docs proficiency

- Comfortable using ChatGPT or Claude for structured research support

- Excellent research skills using multiple tools and sources

- Proven experience in deep research for speaking opportunities and podcasts

- Ability to identify real decision-makers and not just public
s

- Clean formatting and organization skills

- Fast response time, especially when urgent

- Resourceful, proactive, and detail-oriented



This role requires structure, speed, and precision.



Send me your application with the subject: Research Assistant - [Full Name]

title: Lead Generation Specialist (Aesthetics) - WFH
description:
Note: Experience in the aesthetics or wellness industry is a requirement for this role.



Key Responsibilities:



- Lead Generation: Conduct outbound calls to prospective customers, generating qualified leads and setting appointments for our sales team.

- Follow-Up: Actively follow up on leads generated from digital marketing campaigns, including
 marketing, social media, and online advertising.

- Effective Communication: Utilize talking points to effectively engage prospects, communicating the value proposition of our cutting-edge aesthetic treatments and services.

- Lead Qualification: Qualify leads by gathering relevant information on their needs, budget, and timeline, ensuring they align with our offerings.

- CRM Management: Maintain accurate and detailed records of all interactions in our CRM system to ensure streamlined communication and follow-up processes.

- Collaboration: Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to optimize lead generation strategies and improve overall conversion rates.

- Market Awareness: Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market conditions to identify new opportunities for lead generation.

- Target Achievement: Meet or exceed weekly and monthly targets for lead generation and appointment setting.



Requirements:



- Proven experience in outbound telemarketing or sales, preferably in a B2C environment.

- Excellent verbal communication skills and the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively.

- Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on building rapport and establishing trust with prospects.

- Goal-oriented mindset with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding targets.

- Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

- Proficiency in using CRM software and other relevant sales tools.



Preferred Qualifications:

- Experience in the aesthetics or wellness industry.

- Knowledge of advanced CRM systems and sales tools.

- Additional certifications or training in sales techniques or customer service.

The successful applicant must have sound knowledge of australian building and will be required to gain full understanding of our project managment app called wunderbuild. Within the app tasks will include liasing with our staff, clients and sub-contractors. Job scheduling, quantity surveying and estimating.

title: Full Time Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a full-time Talent Acquisition Specialist to join our team and take ownership of our hiring process.



You’ll be responsible for sourcing, screening, and recommending strong candidates across creative and digital roles. This role is ideal for someone who has solid judgment, moves efficiently, and knows how to evaluate quality beyond resumes.



What you’ll be doing:

*Sourcing qualified candidates across different platforms

*Screening resumes and identifying real strengths (not just keywords)

*Conducting initial interviews

*Assessing skills, communication, and culture fit

*Coordinating trial tasks when needed

*Recommending top candidates with clear reasoning

*Helping improve and refine our hiring system

*Tracking hiring progress and maintaining organized records



What we’re looking for:

*Strong judgment in evaluating candidates

*Clear and confident communication

*Organized and detail-oriented

*Ability to move fast without sacrificing quality

*Full-time availability

*Reliable internet connection



Nice to have:

*1 year or more years of recruitment experience

*Experience hiring for content, creative, or digital roles

*Experience in performance-based or output-based teams

*Familiarity with structured interview frameworks

*Experience handling volume hiring



Salary, benefits, and growth:

*Starting salary is $400 per month (full-time)

*Performance-based raises

*Growth potential based on performance and hiring impact

*Philippine holidays observed

*13th month pay provided

*Long-term role (not freelance or short-term)



Why work with us:

*Stable, full-time position

*Structured but fast-moving environment

*Opportunity to grow into a strategic hiring role



How to apply:

Please apply ONLY through this Google Form.

Do not send messages on onlinejobs.ph.

title: Appointment Setter - Outbound Caller - Client Engagement Specialist
description:
Are you looking for more than just a job? Do you want to be part of a team that grows, learns, and succeeds together? If yes - this might be the perfect fit for you.



We are a fast-growing company in the overage recovery business, and we’re on the lookout for passionate A+ talent who is highly qualified, detail-oriented, self-starting, enthusiastic, and a positive team player to join our Team as an Appointment Setter - Outbound Caller - Client Engagement Specialist.



This isn’t just a position about making calls, answering calls or setting appointments - it’s about connecting with people, building trust, and truly changing lives. Every conversation matters and every success is celebrated as a team.



What You Will Do:

• Reach out to former property owners with confidence, care, empathy and professionalism.

• Build meaningful connections and explain how our services can help them.

• Assist in signing up clients when the opportunity arises.

• Use our CRM (we’ll train you fully) to manage leads and track progress.

• Be a true team player - supporting others while also growing yourself.



What We Offer:

• Hourly Pay: $3 - $4 per hour to start (based on experience and performance).

• Room to Grow: Pay increases as you improve and contribute more to the team.

• An Opportunity To Advance: We are looking for leaders and those who have leadership potential. As you grow within our company, you must be willing to take on supervisory and management positions, with increased pay and responsibilities, to help others learn and grow.

• Bonuses: Paid based on the success of the team.

• Full Training Provided: Advanced training in skills to talk with and engage potential clients.

• 8-hour workdays: Work full time and truly look forward to coming to work every day because you know that everything you do is helping to change our client’s lives.

• A Completely Remote Job: Work from anywhere with a strong reliable internet connection.

• A Friendly, Supportive, and Motivating Environment: Where everyone’s success is celebrated.



What We Are Looking For:

•  Someone who loves connecting with people and has great communication skills.

• Someone who is committed, hard-working, dependable, trustworthy and has strong ethical principles.

title: Cx Agent
description:
Cx Agent – Q for Quinn Inc.

About Q for Quinn

Q for Quinn is a purpose-driven apparel company creating the clean, comfortable basics for the whole family. Our products - from GOTS-certified organic cotton underwear to RWS-certified merino wool socks - are designed for sensitive skin and made ethically in Portugal and India. Every pair purchased helps feed a child in need. We have donated more than 450,000 school meals to date!

We’ve grown into a trusted brand among families seeking truly clean clothing, and now we’re ready to expand our footprint in the wholesale and specialty retail market.



Position Overview

The hours are 9am to 5pm EST. There is an opportunity to work 2 shifts such as 7am to 11am EST and 7pm to 11pm EST after training is completed.



We are looking for a Customer Service Agent to support our team by helping customers feel heard, supported, and delighted in every interaction. This role is central to maintaining our reputation for warmth, transparency, and brand care. You will handle inquiries across
, chat, and third-party platforms (such as Amazon and marketplaces), resolve issues efficiently, and ensure customers receive accurate and thoughtful responses.



We are a small team (4 full-time and 3 part-time staff), so the ideal candidate is self-directed, empathetic, resourceful, and aligned with our values of sustainability, transparency, and exceptional customer experience.



Key Responsibilities

Customer Support & Communications

Respond promptly (less than 24 hours) and professionally to customer inquiries via
, chat, and other support platforms.

Provide thoughtful resolutions on orders, returns, product questions, size guidance, delivery issues, and general concerns.

Maintain up-to-date knowledge of product features, new releases, policies, and promotions to ensure accurate responses.

Order Issue Handling

Coordinate with fulfillment teams and carriers to resolve delayed, missing, or damaged shipments.

Assist customers with exchanges, returns, and store credit or refund processing.

Customer Experience & Quality Feedback

Identify recurring customer issues and escalate trends to management on a weekly basis.

Gather and communicate product, fit, and service insights to internal teams to help improve offerings and user experience.

Log products (SKUs and lots) for items that may require further investigation such as re-barcoding, sizing check, manufacturing QC check, etc.

Maintain accurate ticket histories and documentation.

Marketplace & Platform Support

Manage customer communications on Amazon and other third-party platforms with fast response times and high CSAT focus.

Ensure resolution and follow-up meet platform policy requirements.



Qualifications

Experience using Richpanel, Shopify and ShipHero in a similar role (mandatory requirement).

Experience in customer service, customer care, or order support— in e-commerce or consumer products.

Exceptional written communication skills (English): warm, clear, and solution-oriented.

Strong organizational skills with high attention to detail, accuracy, and follow-through.

Comfort navigating multiple systems such as CRM tools,
 inboxes, and order dashboards (e.g., Shopify).

Proactive mindset with the ability to independently resolve issues and prioritize tasks effectively.



Nice to Have

Understanding of apparel sizing and fit challenges for consumers.



Why Join Q for Quinn

Be part of a fast-growing, women-led, purpose-driven brand redefining “clean clothing.”

Work directly with the executive team on maximizing operational efficiency.

Flexible remote or hybrid role with an opportunity to make a measurable impact.

Competitive compensation with performance incentives.

Every sale you help generate contributes to our mission - over 450,000 meals donated to date.

title: Welcome to K-POP Universe: Office Admin Role (Entry-Level) for E-Commerce – Join the Beat!
description:
- Recruitment validity period: Until 3 business days from the date of the first recruitment announcement

- A PH VA team of more than 5 people has already been formed, and business collaboration is possible using Tagalog in a comfortable atmosphere.

- Providing educational tutorial videos and operating a mentorship program to help new comers quickly adapt



[About Us]

* Company Introduction (Video):

youtu.be/dO2mWWZANx8



[Join Summitree and Write Your K-POP Legacy Alongside Filipinos]

Summitree envisions leveraging their Filipino employees' intelligence and English fluency to expand globally while sharing their passion for K-POP. They highlight the Philippines' crucial role in their expansion plans, emphasizing collaboration with their Filipino team to make a mark in the K-POP world. Joining Summitree means joining a multicultural team (Korea, Philippines, Mongolia, Others) with a shared goal of making K-POP history.



[Responsibilities]

We are looking for a “Full-Time” Office Admin to handle our business.

You will be doing a variety of tasks, almost all of which we will create tutorials for you.

1. Order fulfillment and shipping label generation

You will be responsible for gathering and processing customer orders accurately and efficiently. This includes coordinating with third-party logistics (3PL) providers for inbound and outbound shipments to ensure smooth operations.

2. Product listing and scheduling

As a distributor of K-POP records and merchandise, you will be involved in registering new products into our system. This includes managing inventory, updating product information, and ensuring accurate data entry. Additionally, you will be responsible for scheduling release dates and managing timelines using tools like Google Calendar.

3. Customer service support

providing excellent customer service is crucial to us. You will be responsible for addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction. Your communication skills and problem-solving abilities will play a vital role in maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers.



[Required qualifications & skillset (must have)]

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience in puchasing K-POP Album or knowledge of K-POP related products (album, merchandise)

* Idea of how to promote K-POP albums and gain traffics in our shopping mall in PH online K-POP community for each artists



[Desired qualifications & skillset (nice to have)]

* Experience in handling customer service

* Experience in Photoshop

* Experience in
 Ads or Google Ads

* Knowledge and Experience of Microsoft Excel & Familar with Using Various Formula

* Experience in experience in Amazon Business (Familiar with Interface and function) or other E-commerce Platform



[Compensation & Employment Terms]

Position Classification:

This is an entry-level position. All candidates, regardless of prior experience, will undergo structured training under a designated mentor to adapt to our internal systems and operational standards.



• Payment Term: Monthly basis

• Probationary Period: 6 months

o Months 0–3: USD 280/month

o Months 4–6: USD 300/month, subject to satisfactory performance evaluation after the first 3 months

o The probation period may be shortened if you demonstrate fast work adaptation and receive an excellent evaluation. (This has occurred in multiple past cases.)



• After Probation Evaluation (Regularization): USD 300/month

o Performance & Total Compensation Structure:

Upon regularization, employees receive a guaranteed 13th Month Pay and at least one annual performance bonus equivalent to one month’s base salary during peak sales seasons. Additional bonuses may be granted based on company performance. When annualized, the total compensation is equivalent to approximately USD 350–380 per month.

o Continued employment and salary maintenance are subject to overall performance evaluation.

o If performance does not meet expectations, adjustments may be made in accordance with company standards.

• Additional Compensation:

o Performance-based incentives may be provided based on work attitude, responsibility, consistency, and overall contribution.



• After Regularization:

o Annual contract renewal is standard

- Salary adjustments may be made based on performance, teamwork, and overall evaluation.

o If overall performance—including work capability, teamwork, reliability, and internal evaluations—is considered outstanding, salary increases may be granted within a shorter period. (This has occurred in multiple past cases.)

o Exceptional performance may also lead to early promotions or salary increases prior to the annual review.



[Perks & Benefits]

1. Regular Employee Benefits

- 13th Month Salary provided

- 10 additional paid leave days upon regularization

2. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

3. Birthday Benefit (After 6 Months of Employment)

- Receive one free K-POP album of your favorite artist on your birthday

4. Paid Holidays (Regardless of Employment Status)

- January 1st (New Year’s Day) and Christmas Day are paid holidays

- Applies to both probationary and regular employees

5. Long Service Incentive Program

- 1 Year Service: PHP17,000

- 3 Year Service: PHP22,500

- 5 Year Service: PHP28,000



[How To Apply for the job]

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form






Interview via google meet will be conducted after first screening and candidates will be notifed to their
s or
 



Thank you

Summitree

title: Real Estate Transaction Co-Ordinator - Virtual Assistant
description:
If you love working from home as a VA, want to work Philippines business hours, and enjoy having a structured daily workflow and checklists, - we want to hear from you!  



We are looking for a VA to work on back office tasks, making sure the business runs smoothly.  Some marketing and customer service is required, however the main role is keeping on top of all of the real estate sales transactions the whole way through the transaction, to ensure we have the highest level of service to our clients.



Your daily responsibilities would include:

1. Sending a daily report through
, detailing completed and ongoing tasks.

2. Keeping on top of your Trello Board, all Due Dates and following the associated Trello Checklists

3. Database Management of all clients and enquiries, keeping them organised and in the right categories.

4. Organize the
s that come in. Remove spam. Respond to
. Forward
s to respective departments.

5. Schedule, book and confirm inspections and appointments for the team.

6. Sending out marketing and transaction
s to clients



To qualify for the position, you will need: 

1. At least 2 years working as a Virtual Assistant (either from at home or through an Agency)

2. At least 1 year working from home with a stable internet connection and suitable home working environment

3. Desire to work long term in this type of role for one client only

4. Excellent verbal and written English skills

5. Completion of the Onlinejobs.ph DISC and IQ tests prior to application



The real estate environment is very fast paced.  So it’s really important that you are:

? A fast learner who enjoys new challenges

? Pay close attention to detail and choose accuracy over speed

? Like following checklists to the letter



In addition to having excellent English skills , you’ll need to use the applications we listed below. You don’t need to be an

expert in all of them, but you need to be at least familiar with them:

? Web research using search engines like Google & Microsoft Edge

, Instagram, Meta Business Suite)

If you think this is the type of role you want to settle in to long term, then we'd love to hear from you.



Please make sure you include in your application subject line "TRANSACTION CO-ORD" and include in your application why you think you are the perfect fit for this role.

title: Client Coordinator / Admin VA
description:
We are Swiftly Landscaping, a project-based landscaping and hardscape company based in the Niagara Region, Ontario, Canada. We build patios, retaining walls, drainage systems, fences, decks, and more. We are growing fast and need a sharp, reliable VA to help us run our systems so nothing falls through the cracks.



This is a real role with real responsibility — not busy work. You will be the person who keeps the pipeline clean, clients informed, and the back office organized while the owner and field team focus on sales and delivering excellent work.



What You Will Do



- Respond to new leads via text and
 within 5 minutes using our templates (GoHighLevel CRM)

- Log every lead, call, and client interaction in GoHighLevel and QuickBooks — following our exact data standards

- Move pipeline stages in GoHighLevel as jobs progress from New Lead through to Review Requested

- Schedule estimates and jobs on our Google Calendars using our SOPs

- Send day-before reminders and morning-of confirmations to clients

- Collect and file receipts from the crew — rename, organize into Google Drive job folders

- Send aftercare PDF guides to clients after job completion (sod, concrete, hardscape, planting)

- Track and follow up on subcontractor COI and WSIB documents — flag expiries 30 days in advance

- Assist with subcontractor onboarding — check intake forms, organize folders, update approval status

- Prepare and send the weekly sales metrics report every Monday morning using our template

- Run weekly CRM hygiene: merge duplicates, fill missing fields, tag untagged lead sources

- Draft follow-up messages, client texts, and invoice reminders using our templates

- Support employee onboarding — collect TD1 forms, SIN, direct deposit info, organize files

- Manage the Change Order log — file approvals, screenshot proof, update job folders

- Handle any general admin: data entry, document filing, Google Drive organization



What We Are Looking For



- At least 1 year supporting a North American business (Canada or US preferred)

- Comfortable on the phone or managing calls/texts through a VOIP app (we use OpenPhone)

- Strong written English — your client-facing messages need to be professional and clear

- Experience with a CRM (GoHighLevel is a bonus; any CRM experience transfers)

- Experience with QuickBooks or similar accounting software

- Detail-oriented — our CRM data standards are strict and you will follow them exactly

- Self-starter who flags problems early rather than guessing or going quiet

- Reliable — if you commit to a task, it gets done by the deadline



Nice to Have



Experience supporting a trades or construction business

GoHighLevel CRM experience

Familiarity with Google Workspace (Drive, Calendar, Docs, Sheets)



What We Offer



- $5–6 USD/hour depending on experience

- 25–30 hours/week with potential to grow

- Stable, long-term role — we are building a real company and want someone to grow with us

- Clear SOPs for every task — you will never be guessing what to do

- Direct communication with the owner — no layers of management



How to Apply



- Send your application with the subject line: 'Swiftly VA Application — [Your Name]'

Include: (1) a short paragraph about your experience supporting a North American business, (2) the systems you have used (CRM, QuickBooks, Google Workspace, etc.), and (3) your availability and time zone.

We will ask shortlisted applicants to complete a short paid test task before a Zoom interview.

description:
CLIENT SALES REP - FULL-TIME POSITION FOR HIGH PERFORMERS ONLY



WARNING: This isn't your typical "dial and smile" appointment setting role. We're building the #1 renovation growth agency in Australia, and we need absolute killers who thrive under pressure and deliver results. If you're looking for an easy paycheck, keep scrolling.



About ReynMedia



We're a renovator-specific growth agency helping high-ticket renovators ($20K-$100K+ AUD projects) generate consistent revenue. Our clients close $100K+ monthly because we don't mess around with cheap leads or empty promises.



We're scaling FAST: 10 clients now, 50 ASAP, 100 by end of 2026.



Your Mission As Client Sales Rep:



You're the bridge between high-value homeowners and life-changing renovation projects. Every call you make impacts thousands of families getting their dream homes.



Core responsibility: Call and qualify 100% of inbound leads to achieve 30-40% qualification rate.



What You'll Do Daily:



- Call new leads immediately when they come in (speed matters)

- Follow up with existing pipeline prospects

- Qualify homeowners for $20K+ renovation projects

- Track Leads Via GoHighLevel CRM

- Send Leads To Our Clients Directly Via Slack

- Communicate With Our Clients On Lead Specific Information

- Deliver an exceptional customer experience on every call

- Track performance and submit daily reports





Schedule & Compensation:



Hours: 9am-5pm Australian Eastern Daylight Time (full-time)

Base + Commission: $5/AUD + $6 commission for every lead you qualify

Uncapped earning potential - our killers make serious money ($600+ AUD per week)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- 1+ years phone-based B2C sales/appointment setting experience

- Proven ability to build rapport and trust quickly

- Experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred, training provided)

- Elite level organisation and consistency

- Sales-driven mindset with positive attitude

- Available during mandatory hours



BONUS: Prior experience with renovators/home services



Our Culture (Can You Handle It?):

- Pure devotion to delivering best-in-class service

- Extreme accountability - we call each other out

- Elite standards - we don't settle for second place

- Growth focused - personal and professional development

- Fun - a work environment our team loves working in every day



This role is an entry point to higher positions. We promote from within based on performance, commitment, and competency.



Don't Apply If...

- You can't handle direct feedback

- You're just looking for any paycheck

- You don't thrive in high-performance environments

- You can't commit to consistent daily activity



How To Apply:



1. Fill out application form: 
/
. MANDATORY: Record 60-second Vocaroo audio explaining why you'll crush this role

3. We respond within 24-48 hours if you advance to group interview



Applications without Vocaroo submissions videos are automatically rejected.



Spots fill fast when we post these positions. Apply immediately if you're serious about joining the ReynMedia team and helping renovators and homeowners achieve their dreams.

title: Customer Experience Agent (Senior)
description:
About NordStick

NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home-based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high-quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast-growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand—it's a long-term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.

The Role

We are hiring a Senior Customer Service Agent to lead and execute customer support efforts at NordStick. This position is based in the Philippines, with fully remote work and flexible hours to accommodate time zone differences (aligned with US Eastern Time for collaboration).

This is not an entry-level support role. You are not here to just answer tickets. You are here to own customer satisfaction, reduce friction in the support process, and ensure our service scales with growth.

You will operate across customer service, ecommerce systems, data analysis, and cross-functional coordination. You will handle escalations, mentor juniors, and drive improvements. You will be trusted with real responsibility.

If you wait for issues to escalate, this role will be painful. If you spot trends early and implement fixes proactively, you will thrive.

This is a full-time role focused primarily on customer service, with involvement in data-driven insights and partner coordination to enhance the overall customer experience.

Core Responsibilities



Customer Service Leadership and Execution

Lead handling of complex customer inquiries via Rich Panel and other platforms, resolving issues related to orders, shipping, products, returns, and feedback.

Mentor junior agents, provide training on best practices, and ensure consistent high-quality responses.

Analyze customer interactions to identify patterns, pain points, and opportunities for product or process improvements.

Escalate critical issues to leadership and follow through on resolutions.



Ecommerce and Systems Support

Optimize customer journeys on Shopify, including troubleshooting integrations and QA for support-related features.

Support setup, QA, and usage of tools like Rich Panel for CS, Klaviyo for post-purchase communications, and other DTC tools.

Leverage AI tools for automating responses, sentiment analysis, and efficient ticket routing.

Flag and resolve system issues that impact customer experience before they become widespread problems.



Data Analysis and Reporting

Maintain and update Google Sheets for tracking CS metrics, such as response times, resolution rates, NPS, and customer feedback trends.

Use data insights to generate reports and recommend strategies for reducing support volume through proactive measures (e.g., FAQ updates, self-service tools).

Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to align CS data with broader business goals.



Relationship and Process Management

Manage relationships with vendors and partners involved in fulfillment, shipping, or support escalations.

Develop and document workflows for efficient CS operations, including escalation protocols and knowledge bases.

Act as a central point for CS coordination, preparing summaries for team check-ins and ensuring clear communication.

Drive initiatives to improve customer retention through personalized follow-ups and loyalty programs.





What Success Looks Like

Within 30 Days



CS operations run smoothly with reduced response times and no preventable escalations.

Systems and tools are optimized for efficiency.

Initial data reports highlight key trends, and basic improvements are implemented.



Within 90 Days



CS feels proactive and data-driven, with measurable improvements in satisfaction metrics.

Team communication is tight, and processes are streamlined.

Leadership can focus on growth strategy, not day-to-day CS cleanup.



Requirements

You should not apply unless most of the following are true:



You have led or senior-level experience in customer service for DTC ecommerce companies.

You are extremely organized, detail-oriented, and empathetic with customers.

You are proactive, comfortable handling escalations, and making judgment calls.

You communicate clearly, directly, and professionally.

You have hands-on experience with Shopify, Rich Panel, Klaviyo, and Google Sheets.

You are skilled in data analysis, using AI tools for CS optimization, and managing vendor relationships.

You understand DTC ecommerce deeply, including how CS integrates with marketing, operations, and customer journeys.

You can commit full-time, working 40 hours per week, based in the Philippines (with flexibility for US time zone overlap).



If you're passionate about fitness, customer success, and elevating service in a dynamic DTC environment, apply today! Send your resume and a cover letter explaining your relevant CS experience to
